title: Al Montazah Amusement Park - Island of Legends
description:
Welcome to the Island of Legends Sharjah, nestled within the vibrant landscape of Al Montazah Amusement Park. Step into the enchanting 18th century, where the era's inventions and discoveries unfold before your eyes. Here, legends and stories transcend time, inviting you to embark on an adventure like never before. Discover Al Montazah Amusement Park rides, each designed to captivate and awe. Hop aboard the Time Train as it whisks you around the Island of Legends Amusement Park, offering a glimpse into its rich history. Meanwhile, let your children revel in the vibrant hues of the Dancing Flowers, promising a safe and exhilarating experience. More attractions like Le Palais, Teacups, and the Lochness Spin Boat await, each offering a taste of the old world's charm. At the heart of this amusement park lies an ode to time travel, where families and friends unite in an unforgettable journey through celebrated mythology and relentless excitement. Al Montazah Park Island of Legends is not just an amusement park; it's a time traveler's paradise, a haven for adventure-seekers, and a realm where legends thrive. Come, experience the magic firsthand and create timeless memories with your loved ones.

Timings: 
  • Sunday to Thursday: 13:00 to 22:00
  • Friday to Saturday: 15:00 to 00:00

Hightlights:
  • Endless amusement with climbing, crawling and sliding adventures for the little ones.
  • Embark on a magical voyage throughout the theme park.
  • It's an exciting quest to uncover the mysteries of the Loch Ness Monster.
  • Experience unparalleled thrills alongside a colossal Chinese dragon.
  • Vibrant journey featuring an exhilarating freefall experience.
  • Embark on an adventurous journey through snowy Scandinavia.
  • Breathtaking vistas seen from a colossal ferris wheel.
  • It is an exciting ride with upward, downward, and rotational movements.
  • Magical adventure flying high above the ground.
  • Adventurous pursuits tailored for daredevils, ideal for loved ones gathering.

Inclusions & Exclusions:

Inclusion:

  • Entry fee for Island of Legends theme park
  • Explore its more than 25 rides


Exclusion:

  • Pickup and drop-off at the hotel
  • Meals


Important things to know before you visit:

  • Facilities: Food and Beverages(on additional cost), First-Aid, Free Wi-Fi, guest services Desk, Toilets, Lost and Found, ATM, Mosque, Mother & Child Room.
  • Al Montazah Amusement Park Tickets are non-refundable.
  • Children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult at all times.
  • Outside food and beverages are strictly prohibited.
  • Management reserves the right to inspect all bags before entry into the park.
  • Al Montazah Parks provides wheelchairs for people with disabilities at the ticketing counter.
  • Pets are not allowed in the adventure park.
  • Go-pros or similar devices are not allowed on any of the rides.
  • Differently-abled people can avail fast passes so that they don't have to wait in long lines.
  • All-day free parking for all.
  • Parking is available at the entrance and other parking structures across Flag Island.
  • Monitored by our Security Team via CCTV cameras across the parking lots.
  • As we take responsibility for your fun, we request you take care of your kids and be responsible for your belongings.
  • Even though our parking lot is safe and monitored, please do not leave any valuables in the car.
  • We are not responsible for any losses or thefts that may occur in the parking lot.

How to get there:

Getting Here:
  • 25 minutes (19km) approx. from Sharjah International Airport
  • 20 minutes (15.3km) approx. from Dubai International Airport  

By Car:
  • From Dubai: 25 – 30 min
  • From Abu Dhabi: 1hr 30 mins – 2hrs
  • From North Emirates: 2hrs 40 mins
  • The travel time is subject to change depending on the day of travel and traffic  

By Public Transportation: If you’re coming to visit us from Dubai or other neighbouring Emirates, then you may take a bus going to Sharjah – Al Jubail Bus Station. From there, grab a taxi, and we are just a 3-minute ride away (1.2km) or you may choose to walk as its only 5 minutes by walk. title: Tandem Skydive Palm Drop Dubai
description:
Freefall at a speed of 120 miles per hour with gorgeous views of the Palm Jumeirah Island.




What To Expect

Experience the thrill of freefall from a plane at a speed of 120 miles per hour as you skydive over the famous Palm Jumeirah Island from high above with this once-in-a-lifetime tandem skydive experience at Skydive Dubai’s Palm Drop Zone. No prior skydiving experience needed!
A tandem skydive is the quickest and easiest way to experience the thrill of freefall at over 120 miles per hour while securely harnessed to experienced and accomplished instructors.


Highlights

• The only skydiving experience in the region
• Gorgeous views of Palm Jumeirah
• Highly trained instructors


What’s included in the ticket

• Basic training with professional instructors
• Tandem skydive with a trained skydiving instructor
• Safety gear
• Photographs and edited video


Timing: 
8 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.


Skydive Dubai Ticket Information:

• Bookings for Skydive Dubai are final and non-refundable (except in case of bad weather)
• No-shows and late cancellations are non-refundable.
• Please carry a filled and signed copy of the Tandem Waiver form
• Please carry a valid photo ID with you.


Important things to know before your visit

• Skydive Dubai Dress Code: Athletic clothes are recommended. No collared shirts, low-cut blouses, sleeveless shirts, shorts, or crop tops are allowed to avoid any issues in wearing the harness. Only closed shoes are allowed. Your footwear must be secure and tight, or it will come off during the drop.

• Skydive Dubai Age and Health Restrictions
   ‚ó¶ Age limit: All participants must be at least 18 years of age. Participants over 70 must bring a Declaration of Fitness form, which must be completed, signed, and stamped by your doctor.
   ‚ó¶ Pregnant women are not allowed to participate in skydiving.
   ‚ó¶ Medical restrictions: If you suffer from or have previously suffered from any of the conditions listed below, kindly download and fill out the Declaration of Fitness form before your arrival.
      ‚óæ Epilepsy
      ‚óæ Fits
      ‚óæ Severe head injury
      ‚óæ Recurrent blackouts or giddiness

title: Princes' Islands Tour (2 Islands) Guide,Ticket & Lunch from Istanbul
description:
Escape the bustling streets of Istanbul and unwind with an official guide on a full-day nature trip to Princes' Islands. Embark on a captivating cruise to The Princes' Islands, including a delightful pause at 2 islands B√ºy√ºkada and Kƒ±nalƒ±ada. Tour Timings:

Duration: 8 Hours
Open: The tour starts at approximately 09:00 a.m. & ends around 05:30 p.m.

Itinerary:
  • Embark on a boat journey offering views of Istanbul's landmarks from the water.
  • See vintage mansions, seaside cottages nestled among beaches, and pine-fringed landscapes. 
  • Savor a complimentary lunch at a delightful local restaurant with a captivating sea view.
  • Savoring the freedom to explore Buyukada & Kinaliada Islands at your own pace.
Experience the convenience of being picked up from your Istanbul hotel before making your way to the port for a seamless boarding onto your boat.Step aboard a boat and cruise the Sea of Marmara. Find your perfect spot on the decks, relax, and enjoy the Istanbul's landmarks. Engage with your guide as they share captivating insights into the island's rich history during the remainder of the journey.

Pause at Kinaliada & Buyukada Islands, the most visited among the Princes' Islands. Explore on foot the enchanting old buildings, mansions, and villas that grace the islands, serving as residences for the locals or rent a bike, scooter or take electric car tour as cars aren't allowed on the islands.

Choose from fish, meat or chicken menus in Büyükada and Savor a complimentary lunch at a delightful local restaurant with a captivating sea view.

Finally, in Buyukada find your guide at the designated meeting point for the boat ride back to Istanbul. Upon your return from the island, you'll have the opportunity to stop by a local leather shop. Following this visit, you'll be transferred to your hotel in Istanbul. Should you choose not to visit the shop, feel free to depart from the group at the port and make your own way back to your hotel.

Get ready for an unforgettable adventure with our Prince Islands Tour Istanbul! Step aboard our comfortable boat and set sail on the stunning Sea of Marmara. As you cruise along, soak in the breathtaking views of Istanbul's iconic landmarks while finding your perfect spot on the decks to relax and unwind.  

We'll make a stop at Kinaliada & Buyukada Islands, the jewels of the Princes' Islands. Take a leisurely stroll through the charming streets adorned with historic buildings, mansions, and villas. Or, if you're feeling adventurous, rent a bike, scooter, or hop on an electric car tour to explore every nook and cranny of the islands. 

Hungry? Don't worry! Indulge in a delectable lunch with options ranging from fish, meat, to chicken menus at a delightful local restaurant. Afterward, meet your guide for the return boat ride to Istanbul. Before heading back to the city, we'll make a quick stop at a local leather shop, where you can pick up some unique souvenirs.

If shopping isn't your thing, feel free to head back to your hotel straight from the port. Join us for an enchanting day exploring the Prince Islands and creating memories to last a lifetime! Princes Island tour with lunch awaits you!

title: Istanbul: Sapanca, Masukiye, Mahmudiye Day Trip with Lunch
description:
Seek refuge from the bustling streets of Istanbul and experience a day of tranquility in the countryside with an official guide on the Sapanca-Masukiye-Mahmudiye Nature trip. Explore Sapanca, Masukiye, Mahmudiye, Sapanca Lake, and the zoo as you unwind and embrace the serenity of nature.

Tour Timings

Open: The tour starts at approximately 09:00 a.m. & ends around 09:30 p.m.

Itinerary:

  • Be captivated by the breathtaking landscapes of Sapanca,Masukiye and Mahmudiye.
  • Enhance your adventure by purchasing tickets for thrilling activities such as a giant swing, a forest zipline, cable car or ATV.
  • Indulge in a delightful lunch at a restaurant nestled next to the river.
  • Wrap up your day with a sweet treat by visiting a Turkish delight factory.

Embark on an unforgettable tour starting with a across the iconic Bosphorus Bridge, connecting the continents of Europe and Asia. Explore the natural wonders and attractions of Sapanca, Masukiye and Mahmudiye which is about a 2-hour drive from Istanbul, including Zoo (Depending on the weather, we sometimes visit Darƒ±ca Faruk Yalcin Zoo and sometimes Tuzla Aslan Park).

Visit Sapanca, itself is a small town with a relaxed ambiance. It has a mix of modern amenities and a rural charm, providing a pleasant escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

Have unforgettable times in Masukiye & Mahmudiye are a nearby villages often visited in conjunction with Sapanca. Villages are known for its natural beauty, waterfalls and fresh air. It is a popular spot for outdoor activities like hiking, Quad Bike, Zip Line and Cable Car. Join the activities if you want or simply enjoying the scenic views.

Visit Sapanca Lake, where you can enjoy a peaceful walk along the shore and take in the natural beauty. This tour promises a delightful blend of scenic landscapes and fascinating animal encounters, providing a memorable experience in the heart of nature.

Continuing your journey, Masukiye and Mahmudiye beckon with their enchanting villages, nestled amidst breathtaking natural landscapes adorned with cascading waterfalls. title: Topkapƒ± Palace & Harem & Hagia Irene Church & Live Guide
description:
Experience Topkapi Palace and Harem with a history knowledgeable guide, skip the ticket line and benefit from the convenience of hotel pick-up & drop off.

Tour Timings:

Duration: 04 Hours
Open: The tour starts at approximately 01:00 p.m. & ends around 05:30 p.m


Itinerary:

  • Explore the residence of sultans at Topkapi Palace, with skip the line ticket.
  • Embark on a guided tour to explore the treasury of the Ottoman Empire and holy relics.
  • Dive into the history of the Ottoman Empire as you explore museum
  • Uncover the mysteries of Constantinople's first church, the Hagia Irene Church.

Enjoy the convenience of a hotel pick-up & drop off & to get skip the line ticket (Don't wait in the ticket line for hours, pay your ticket fee in Turkish Lira cash to your guide. Let your guide buy your skip the line ticket for you) before embarking on your guided tour.

Visit Topkapƒ± Palace, formerly the exclusive abode of the Ottoman Sultans, served as the primary residence and administrative headquarters of the Ottoman Sultans for over 400 years.

See exhibits of sacred Islamic relics of Prophet Mohammed, imperial treasures, Chinese porcelain, weapons, and calligraphy works.

The harem, situated within the expansive confines of Topkapƒ± Palace, served as the residence for the sultan, his mother, concubines, wives, other female relatives, and the offspring born within this secluded domain. By venturing through the Harem section, you will discover a myriad of rooms, courtyards and chambers that reflect the complex cultural, social and political complexities of the Ottoman Empire.

Proceed to the Hagia Irene Church, a significant landmark from the Byzantine era and notably the first church constructed in Constantinople. This ancient structure holds immense historical and architectural importance, offering insights into the early Christian heritage of the city.

Conclude your exploration with a comfortable drop-off at your hotel, ensuring a seamless and convenient conclusion to your day of sightseeing.

title: Istanbul: Topkapi Palace-Harem, Basilica Cistern, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia with Live Guide
description:
Explore the highlights of Istanbul with an enjoyable tour that includes Topkapƒ± Palace and Harem, Basilica Cistern, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia, accompanied by an expert guide. Don't miss this fun historical tour! Tour Timings

Duration: 08 Hours
Open: The tour starts at approximately 09:00 a.m. & ends around 05:30 p.m.

Itinerary
  • Discover the wonders of the Basilica Cistern with a guide
  • Step into the 6th-century Hagia Sophia Grand Mosque and delve into its rich history.
  • Experience the grandeur and allure of Islamic architecture at the Blue Mosque
  • Explore the residence of sultans at Topkapƒ± Palace & Harem with a guide
  • Look for a bargain as you pass by hundreds of stalls in the Grand Covered Bazaar
  • Uncover the mysteries of Constantinople's first church, the Hagia Irene Church
Discover the wonders of Istanbul with our expert guide as you embark on a journey through the city's rich history and cultural gems. Whether you find your guide at the meeting point or opt for the convenience of being picked up from centrally-located hotels, our air-conditioned coach ensures a comfortable ride to the departure point.

Your adventure begins at the iconic Blue Mosque, where you'll marvel at its 20,000 blue Iznik ceramic tiles and six towering minarets. Delve into its history, learning how it was constructed for Sultan Ahmet I, marking the culmination of the Classical period.

Next, immerse yourself in the sporting and social center of ancient Constantinople at the Hippodrome. Explore the German Fountain of Wilhelm II, the Bronze Serpentine Column, the Obelisk of Theodosius, and the Column of Constantine. Pause in awe in front of the historic Hagia Sophia, a 6th-century marvel built by Emperor Justinian as a Greek Orthodox Church. Gain insights into its transformative journey, having been the largest church in the world for a millennium.

Continue your exploration at the enchanting Basilica Cistern, avoiding ticket lines to uncover its wonders beneath Istanbul's streets. Stroll through intriguing chambers, marvel at impressive architecture, and encounter the legendary Medusa heads from Greek mythology.

Indulge in a shopping experience for memorable gifts at a selected store before entering the bustling Grand Bazaar, the oldest and biggest covered market in the world. Lose yourself in its 65 streets with over 4000 shops.

After the lunch break continue your adventure with a Visit to Topkapi Palace, the opulent former residence and administrative center of Ottoman Sultans for over four centuries. Don't wait in the ticket line for hours, pay your ticket fee in Turkish Lira cash to your guide.

Let your guide buy your skip the line ticket for you. Marvel at the priceless treasures on display, including sacred Islamic relics, imperial artifacts, and exquisite works of art.

Admire the intricacies of the Harem, a secluded residence within Topkapƒ± Palace, housing the sultan, his mother, concubines, wives, and other female relatives. Explore its myriad rooms, courtyards, and chambers reflecting the cultural, social, and political intricacies of the Ottoman Empire.

Proceed to the Hagia Irene Church, a significant Byzantine landmark and the first church constructed in Constantinople. Gain insights into the early Christian heritage of the city through this ancient structure. Conclude your immersive journey with a comfortable drop-off at your hotel, ensuring a seamless and convenient end to your day of exploration in Istanbul, Turkey.

Visit the Blue Mosque to admire its 20,000 blue Iznik ceramic tiles and its 6 towering minarets. Find out how it was built for Sultan Ahmet I and how it was the last great mosque of the Classical period.

Make your way to the sporting and social center of ancient Constantinople at the Hippodrome. View the German Fountain of Wilhelm II, the Bronze Serpentine Column, the Obelisk of Theodosius, and the Column of Constantine.

Stop in front of Hagia Sophia. Learn about this 6th century building that was constructed by the emperor Justinian as a Greek Orthodox Church. Hear about how the Hagia Sophia has transformed over time and how it was the largest church in the world for 1000 years.

Continue to the Basilica Cistern, avoid the hassle of waiting in lengthy ticket lines and uncover the wonders of the Basilica Cistern beneath the enchanting streets of Istanbul. Immerse yourself in the ancient beauty of this subterranean marvel as you stroll through its intriguing chambers, marveling at the impressive architecture and encountering the legendary Medusa heads from Greek mythology.

Indulge in a shopping for memorable gifts at the store we'll visit prior to reaching the Grand Bazaar. Take as stroll through the Grand Covered Bazaar, the oldest and biggest covered market in the world. Get lost in 65 streets with more than 4000 shops.

In the afternoon, hop aboard the coach for a scenic exploration of the Golden Horn by bus. Allow your guide to narrate the journey, pointing out historic wooden houses, churches, synagogues, mosques, and remnants of the Roman Wall as you traverse the captivating landscape.  

Ascend the Pierre Loti Hill by bus and snap some photos of sweeping views of the Golden Horn. Marvel at city views as you descend the hill on a cable car ride.

Visit the Eyup Sultan Mosque and see the Abu Eyup Alansari Tomb (Abu Ayyub al-Ansari was the standard bearer and companion of Muhammad) The Mosque, due to its unique sacredness, it was the place where the coronation ceremonies of new Ottoman Sultans took place. Sultans came here processing along the grand Cülus Yolu (Accession Way) - to be girded with the Sword of Osman at the start of their reigns.

Take in the city sights from the sea on a Bosphorus cruise. Capture pictures of the Golden Horn, the Topkapƒ± palace, the Dolmabahçe palace, the Hagia Sophia Mosque, the Maiden’s tower, Galata tower, the Blue Mosque, Ortaköy mosque. Gaze out at the bridges connecting Europe and Asia. At the end of your tour, return to your pickup point by coach.

Step into another world as you delve into the rich history of the famous Blue Mosque. Discover the captivating story of the Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, a 6th-century masterpiece transformed over time. 

Indulge in a shopping experience before entering the Grand Bazaar, a sprawling market with over 4000 shops and 65 streets. Capture the essence of Istanbul from the sea on a mesmerizing Bosphorus cruise tour, photographing landmarks like the Topkapƒ± Palace, Dolmabahçe Palace, Hagia Sophia Mosque, Maiden’s Tower, Galata Tower, Ortaköy Mosque, and the bridges connecting Europe and Asia.

title: Full Day Uzungol Tour From Trabzon
description:
Located 99 km from Trabzon and 19 km from Caykara district, at an altitude of 1090 m above sea level, Uzungol surpasses the beauty of the Alps with its steep slopes and magnificent forest. The lake, located in the middle of the valley and formed by the rocks falling from the slopes blocking the Haldizen Stream, is known as "Uzungol" and the same name was given to the surrounding area. Especially the old wooden houses of the nearby "Serah" village, built in a style suitable for the region, complement the beauty of nature. In terms of wildlife, the mountains around Uzungol are home to various animal species such as bears, wolves, wild goats, foxes and Caucasian mountain roosters. A type of black tea is produced in Turkey and grows on the Eastern Black Sea coast. This type of tea is popularly called Turkish tea. It is brewed with powdered roasted black tea and served in unique small glasses known as "ince belli" which translates to ‚Äúsmall waist‚Äù. In this method, tea is made using a teapot or samovar consisting of two parts.

Highlights:
  • Situated at an altitude of 1090 m above sea level.
  • Uzungol boasts steep slopes and a lush forest.
  • The lake formed by rocks blocking Haldizen Stream shares its name with the surrounding area.
  • Nearby Serah village features old wooden houses, adding to the charm.
  • Rich wildlife including bears, wolves, wild goats, foxes, and Caucasian mountain roosters.
  • Turkish tea, grown on the Eastern Black Sea coast, is served in unique "ince belli" glasses.
  • Traditional tea-making involves a two-part teapot or samovar.

Tour Timing's:
  • Duration: 08 Hours
  • The tour starts at approximately 10:00 a.m. & ends around 06:00 p.m.

Inclusions:

  • Tour guide (Turkish, Arabic, English)
  • Transportation on sharing basis
  • Travel Insurance
  • pick-up & drop-off from 03 locations only (In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport)

Exclusions:

  • Lunch
  • Pick & drop from hotel


Tour Departure Point:
  • Meeting Point-01 : In front of Zagnos Tour Agency
  • Meeting Point-02 : Trabzon Square
  • Meeting Point-03 : Across from the airport


Tour Itinerary:

TRABZON - Surmene Knife Sections - Tea Factory - Turkish Delight Shop - Uzungol Observation Terrace - Kiremitli Bridge.

Uzungol day tour starts every day at 10:00 by meeting at our office with our vehicle. After picking up the guests, our first stop is the world-famous Surmene Knife Sections where you can take a look at high-quality knives that you can use for many years.

Our next stop is the tea factory which has an important part in the Blacksea culture. You can drink Turkish tea and learn about the journey of the tea. Guests can also buy Turkish tea if they like. Before reaching Uzungol, we stop by a shop that sells delicacies such as Turkish delight, honey, and dessert.

Afterward, we set off for Uzungol. In order to watch the view, we go up the Uzungol Observation Terrace. After witnessing the breathtaking view, you can enjoy a free time where you can have lunch and take a stroll around Uzungol.

Once the free time is over, everyone gathers at the meeting point that was decided beforehand. On the way back to Trabzon, we take a break for you to take photos of the historic Kiremitli Bridge.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Pick-up & drop-off only from In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport.
  • Guest need to be present at the meeting point mentioned above.
  • A Seat number is not given in the vehicle layout plan. You can sit where it is suitable.
  • The vehicle brand and model are not specified. The agency can change vehicles when necessary.
  • The agency has the right to make changes to some points of the program depending on weather, road conditions and season.
  • Our tours are accompanied by group leaders in Turkish, English or Arabic whenever possible. However, no guarantee is given in this regard.
  • The Black Sea region has a climate in which you can experience all four seasons at the same time. We recommend that you check the weather forecast and plan your outfits accordingly.

Only 99 km from Trabzon, and 1090 m above sea level, Uzungol fascinates its visitors with its lake which is the reincarnation of beauty, forests, and steep valleys. The natural beauty of this quiet retreat is completed by the rustic wooden houses of the village of Serah.

Begin your full day Uzungol tour at 10:00 am, visiting the famous Sürmene Knife Sections to see high-quality, handmade knives. Further, proceed to the tea factory to discover the culture of Black Sea tea, taste freshly brewed Turkish tea, and learn about its route from leaf to cup.

During this journey, stop to pay a visit to a local store where you can purchase Turkish sweets, honey and other treats. Once you reach Uzungol, go up to the observation terrace to take in the mesmerizing view. You can also browse the surroundings, take a walk around the lake, or enjoy a delicious lunch during your free time.

As you wrap up the day, take a break to capture stunning photos at Kiremitli Bridge. Enjoy the Full Day Uzungol Tour that combines cultural and scenic experiences that will take you to the heart of the Black Sea region.

title: Full Day Sumela Tour From Trabzon
description:
Sumela Monastery, built on a steep cliff on the outskirts of Karadag overlooking the Altindere valley, within the borders of Altindere Village of Macka District of Trabzon, is popularly known as "Virgin Mary" among the locals. Located approximately 300 meters above the valley, the building has continued the tradition of establishing monasteries outside the city, in forests, caves and watersides. It is said that the monastery founded in the name of the Virgin Mary took its name "Sumela" from the word "melas" meaning "black". Although this name is thought to come from the dark Montenegro Mountains where the monastery was founded, the word Sumela can be attributed to the black color of the Virgin Mary depiction there. According to legend, the monastery, which was founded by two priests named Barnabas and Sophranios from Athens during the time of Byzantine Emperor Theodosius I (375-395), was repaired by one of his generals, Belisarios, in the 6th century, when Emperor Justinianus requested that the monastery be repaired and expanded. Karaca Cave, which takes its name from the neighborhood of the village where it is located, is a magnificent natural wonder that came to being naturally after millions of years, was engraved with patience, and every point was given the same care. Karaca Cave, located just southwest of Karaca District within the borders of Cebeli Village in the Torul district of G√ºm√º≈ühane, is 17 km away from the city center and 1550 meters above sea level. Hamsikoy is an old stopover located at the northern foot of Zigana Mountain, 19 km away from Macka District, on the northern route of the Silk Road from China and India to Europe. Its name comes from the Arabic Hamse village (Five villages) and consists of five separate settlements. Hamsikoy Rice Pudding: The feature of Hamsikoy Rice Pudding is that the delicious milk originating from the floral flora of the region is cooked using a special cooking technique, using only rice, sugar and salt, for as long as an hour.

Highlights:

Sumela Monastery:
  • Built on a steep cliff overlooking Altƒ±ndere valley in Trabzon.
  • Popularly known as "Virgin Mary" among locals.
  • Continues the tradition of establishing monasteries outside the city.

Karaca Cave:

  • Magnificent natural wonder in Torul district, Gumushane.
  • Formed over millions of years with meticulous care.

Hamsikoy:
  • Ancient stopover on the Silk Road route, near Zigana Mountain.
  • Comprised of five separate settlements.

Hamsikoy Rice Pudding:

  • Signature dish using local milk and special cooking technique.
  • Ingredients include rice, sugar, and salt, cooked for an hour.


Tour Timing's:
  • Duration: 08 Hours
  • The tour starts at approximately 09:30 a.m. & ends around 05:30 p.m.

Inclusions:

  • Tour guide (Turkish, Arabic, English)
  • Transportation on sharing basis
  • Travel Insurance
  • pick-up & drop-off from 03 locations only (In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport)

Exclusions:

  • Lunch
  • Pick & drop from hotel
  • Museum and archeological site entry fees


Tour Departure Point:
  • Meeting Point-01 : In front of Zagnos Tour Agency
  • Meeting Point-02 : Trabzon Square
  • Meeting Point-03 : Across from the airport


Tour Itinerary:

Trabzon - Sumela Monastery - Zigana Mountain - Hamsikoy - Torul Glass Terrace - Karaca Cave - Pestle Kome Tasting  

We start the one-day Sümela, Zigana, Hamsiköy, Torul Glass Terrace, and Karaca Cave tour at 09:30 by meeting at our office. After picking up the guests on the route and a 45-minute drive, we reach the parking area of Sumela Monastery, a magnificent place in the Macka district adorned with rich history, religious importance and natural beauty. We get on the shuttles that will drop us off at the path of Sumela Monastery. After 10 minutes of walking on the path, we will reach the monastery. After visiting the monastery, we will return to the shuttles by walking back on the path and then reach our vehicle.

After about 45 minutes, we will reach our next stop, the summit of Zigana Mountain. Being located at an altitude of approximately 2000 m, this spot offers a breathtaking view as well as a delicious lunch. The following spot is Hamsikoy, where you can taste the famous Hamsikoy rice pudding. Then, we pass through the Zigana tunnel, the 3rd longest tunnel in the world, and reach the Torul Glass Terrace, which stands out with its 240m height, located in the Torul district. Then, we reach the Karaca cave, magnificent with its stalactites, stalagmites and travertines.

We conclude the tour in Trabzon by stopping by the sales office of fruit pulp and kome, which are sweet varieties specific to Gumushane region.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Pick-up & drop-off only from In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport.
  • Guest need to be present at the meeting point mentioned above.
  • A Seat number is not given in the vehicle layout plan. You can sit where it is suitable.
  • The vehicle brand and model are not specified. The agency can change vehicles when necessary.
  • The agency has the right to make changes to some points of the program depending on weather, road conditions and season.
  • Our tours are accompanied by group leaders in Turkish, English or Arabic whenever possible. However, no guarantee is given in this regard.
  • The Black Sea region has a climate in which you can experience all four seasons at the same time. We recommend that you check the weather forecast and plan your outfits accordingly.
Start the full day Sumela tour at 9:30 from our office and drive to Sumela Monastery, which is located in the Macka district in a 45-minute scenic drive. Arrive in the car park area and then take a shuttle bus to the pathway leading to the monastery. After a short walk, visit the magnificent structure on the cliff face, with a deep history and spiritual importance, before backtracking to get back on the course of action.

After that, we go up Zigana Mountain, which is roughly 2000 meters high. One will enjoy this great view with a nice lunch at the top. Next, we visit Hamsikoy, which is famous for creamy rice pudding with fresh milk from that region, prepared with traditional recipes for different tastes.

Our tour continues through the Zigana Tunnel, which is the third longest in the world, to the Torul Glass Terrace. Situated 240 meters above the ground, this is a panoramic platform providing an exhilarating view of the Torul district. We will see the magnificent Karaca Cave, adorned with interesting stalactites, stalagmites, and travertines.

Before the tour concludes, we visit a shop that sells traditional fruit pulp and kome-sweets unique to the region of Gumushane. This full-day excursion brings together history, natural beauty, and local flavors in an unforgettable exploration of Trabzon's wonders.

title: Full Day Batumi Tour From Trabzon
description:
On the east coast of the Black Sea, 15 km from the Turkish border, Batum was founded on fertile and flat land in the northeast of where the Coruh River flows into the sea. It is one of the most important ports of the Soviet Union on the Black Sea. Recently, it has been the shining star of Georgia. The city, which has managed to preserve its historical values ‚Äã‚Äãand cultural riches, also continues to develop and grow with an innovative perspective. You will have very different feelings in the short time you spend in this city, which we can call the city of love and the city of lights.

Highlights:
  • Strategic Location: Batum, nestled on the Black Sea's east coast near the Turkish border, serves as a vital Soviet
  • Rising Georgian Gem: Batum shines as Georgia's burgeoning city, blending history, culture, and innovation.
  • Cultural Haven: Preserving its historical and cultural heritage, Batum evolves with a modern edge.
  • Charm of the City: Known as the "City of Love and Lights," Batum promises a memorable experience with its romantic ambiance.

Tour Timing's:
  • Duration: 15 Hours
  • The tour starts at approximately 08:00 a.m. & ends around 11:00 p.m.

Inclusions:

  • Tour guide (Turkish & English)
  • Transportation on sharing basis
  • Travel Insurance
  • In-Vehicle Refreshments
  • pick-up & drop-off from 03 locations only (In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport)

Exclusions:

  • Lunch
  • Pick & drop from hotel
  • Other expenses


Tour Departure Point:
  • Meeting Point-01 : In front of Zagnos Tour Agency
  • Meeting Point-02 : Trabzon Square
  • Meeting Point-03 : Across from the airport

Important Information:

  • Turkish or EU guests who will join our tour must have a New Type Chip ID card or Passport and keep it with them.
  • For persons under the age of 18, the accompaniment of both parents is required or a notarized consent form is required.
  • All child participants, including newborn babies, must have photo IDs.
  • It is recommended that you keep cash with you for any additional expenses during the tour.

Tour Itinerary:

Trabzon – Sarp Border Gate – Batum City Center - Europe Square – Ali and Nino statue   When there are enough participants for the Batum tour, we meet at our office at 08:00.

After picking up our guests we take a break in Rize and set off towards Sarp Border Gate. After completing all the necessary procedures with our guide, we meet on the Georgian side.

First, we witness the greatness of the Sarp Waterfall and the statue of St. Andrew located right next to it.

Afterward, we stop by the exchange office to convert our Turkish lira into Georgian lari. Then, as we move towards Batum city center with its interesting architecture that changes and develops along the coastline, we reach the city center while seeing the Coruh River, Batum Airport, Upside Down House and the petrol station designed in the shape of a space shuttle.

After this point, our tour continues on foot with a guide. We start our tour by seeing the epic Ali and Nino Statue on Batum Boulevard, meeting each other every 10 minutes. Then we get on the boat with guests who wish to join the boat tour and take magnificent photographs while sailing to the city of Batum on the sea. If we are lucky, dolphins accompany us. After the boat tour, we take some time to have lunch and complete our city tour by seeing places such as Piazza Square, St. Nicholas Church, European Square, Medea Statue, Astronomical Clock, Poseidon Statue, Alphabet Tower, and then our guests can have at least 2.5 hours of free time.

At the end of the free time, we meet at the designated point and start our return journey. After completing the procedures at customs, we arrive in Trabzon.  

Important things to know before your visit:
  • Pick-up & drop-off only from In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport.
  • Guest need to be present at the meeting point mentioned above.
  • A Seat number is not given in the vehicle layout plan. You can sit where it is suitable.
  • The vehicle brand and model are not specified. The agency can change vehicles when necessary.
  • The agency has the right to make changes to some points of the program depending on weather, road conditions and season.
  • Our tours are accompanied by group leaders in Turkish, English or Arabic whenever possible. However, no guarantee is given in this regard.
  • The Black Sea region has a climate in which you can experience all four seasons at the same time. We recommend that you check the weather forecast and plan your outfits accordingly.
On the enchanting east coast of the Black Sea, just 15 km from the Turkish border, Batumi stands proudly on fertile and flat land where the Coruh River gracefully meets the sea. Serving as a crucial port during the Soviet Union era, Batumi has emerged as the radiant star of Georgia in recent times.  

This city, a blend of historical charm and cultural opulence, not only preserves its heritage but also embraces growth and innovation. Batumi, often hailed as the city of love and lights, promises a unique and unforgettable experience. For the Batumi tour, participants gather at our office at 08:00.  

Commencing our tour from Trabzon to Batumi with the pick-up of our guests, we make a refreshing stop in Rize before heading towards the Sarp Border Gate. With our guide's assistance, we complete the necessary procedures and meet on the Georgian side.  

Our journey unfolds with the grandeur of the Sarp Waterfall and the adjacent statue of St. Andrew. We pause to convert Turkish lira to Georgian lari at the exchange office, then proceed to Batumi city center. Along the coastline, we marvel at the changing architecture, catching glimpses of the Coruh River, Batumi Airport, the Upside Down House, and a petrol station designed as a space shuttle.  

Continuing on foot with our guide, we begin the tour by witnessing the Ali and Nino Statue on Batumi Boulevard, an epic sight where the figures meet every 10 minutes. Guests can opt for a boat tour to capture stunning photos of Batumi from the sea, potentially accompanied by dolphins. Following the boat tour, we break for lunch and resume our city exploration, visiting landmarks such as Piazza Square, St. Nicholas Church, European Square, Medea Statue, Astronomical Clock, Poseidon Statue, and the Alphabet Tower. Subsequently, guests enjoy a minimum of 2.5 hours of free time.  

As the free time concludes, we regroup at the designated point and embark on our return journey. After customs procedures, we arrive back in Trabzon, completing a memorable excursion from Trabzon to Batumi and exploring the wonders of Turkey to Georgia.

title: Full Day Ayder Tour From Trabzon
description:

The waterfalls and hot springs make this place famous. Beginning the tour at 09:00, you'll drive to Eskitoƒülu Waterfall, a beautiful two-tiered fall from 80 meters. Travel through Rize city center to the captivating Fƒ±rtƒ±na Valley, where you can pause by the river for activities like rafting, ziplining, or relaxing on a swing. Passing through lush green roads, enter Ka√ßkar Mountains National Park and reach the Ayder Plateau, a serene haven with panoramic views and charming local attractions. Enjoy some free time, starting from a small restaurant near Ayder, and visit the Gelint√ºl√º Waterfall 500 meters away. Taste the local dishes of corn flour halva. Enjoy the serenity of the plateau with fresh mountain air and scenic surroundings. On the way back, take a break near √áamlƒ±hem≈üin to photograph Kale-i Hala, an 18th-century stone bridge rich in history. Finally, visit a local shop offering traditional Rize cloths to make unique souvenir purchases. This tour blends natural wonders with cultural jewels.

  • Gelintulu Waterfall: A magnificent sight nestled within Ayder Plateau.

Our daily Ayder tour starts at 09:00 every day by meeting at our office. After picking up the guests, our first stop before we reach Rize is Eskitoglu Waterfall which falls in two levels from a height of approximately 80 meters and is only 500 meters away from the sea. Afterward, we travel through the Rize city center and head off to the Firtina valley.

We take a break near the Firtina River where activity areas are located and allow you to enjoy this time with activities such as rafting, ziplining and getting on the swing. Finally, passing through the roads that offer us all shades of green, we enter the Kackar Mountains National Park and reach Ayder Plateau.

We park our car in front of the restaurant and give you free time for lunch and sightseeing. During this time, you can visit the Gelintulu Waterfall, located about 500 meters above, and taste the corn flour halva made according to the season. At the end of the free time, we meet at the designated point and start the return journey.

Just before coming to Camlƒ±hemsin district, we take photos at the historical stone bridge called Kale-i Hala, which was built in the 18th century.

Finally, we end our tour in Trabzon by visiting a store where some of the famous Rize cloths are produced and where you can buy local souvenirs.

title: Full Day Hidirnebi Cal Cave Tour From Trabzon
description:
Hidirnebi Plateau, one of the plateaus of Akcaabat, a district of Trabzon famous for its meatballs, is one of the most well-known and famous plateaus in the region. Offering a slice of the unique natural beauty of the Black Sea, Hidirnebi Plateau is also known as "Dernek Cimeni" by the local people. The fog that suddenly descends on the Hidirnebi Plateau adds a fantastic atmosphere to the area. The plateau offers its visitors a unique view where they can watch Akcaabat and the surrounding villages from an observation deck in clear weather, and in cloudy weather, it spreads seas of clouds under your feet. We can say that July is the ideal time for those who want to participate in the plateau festivals and witness the culture of the region. In short, you can visit this place whenever you want, which gives its visitors unforgettable memories with its nature in spring and summer and fascinates with its wonderful snow views in winter. A small stream flows through the √áal cave, which is also considered the second longest cave in the world, and there is a historical castle above the cave.

Highlights:
  • Renowned for meatballs and breathtaking views
  • Dubbed "Dernek Cimeni" by locals
  • Panoramic vistas and mesmerizing fog
  • July hosts vibrant cultural festivals
  • Year-round allure: from lush greens to snowy landscapes
  • Discover Cal cave and its historic castle

Tour Timing's:
  • Duration: 08 Hours
  • The tour starts at approximately 10:00 a.m. & ends around 06:00 p.m.

Inclusions:

  • Tour guide (Turkish, Arabic, English)
  • Transportation on sharing basis
  • Travel Insurance
  • pick-up & drop-off from 03 locations only (In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport)

Exclusions:

  • Lunch
  • Pick & drop from hotel
  • Museum and archeological site entry fees


Tour Departure Point:
  • Meeting Point-01 : In front of Zagnos Tour Agency
  • Meeting Point-02 : Trabzon Square
  • Meeting Point-03 : Across from the airport


Tour Itinerary:

Trabzon - Cal Cave - Hidirnebi Plateau - Sera Lake   We start the one-day Hidirnebi, Cal Cave tour at 10:00 by meeting at our office. After picking up our guests, our first stop is Cal Cave which is 30 km away from the Akcaabat district of Trabzon.

Cal Cave, one of the few large caves in Turkey and the world, is an important natural beauty with its millions of years old stalactites, stalagmites and cave waterfalls. The cave is divided into two branches at 200 meters after the entrance. The branch to the left is approximately 150 meters long. In the room at the end of this branch, there is a chimney through which the water from the doline flows. The accessible part of the right branch is approximately 400 meters.

After visiting this unique cave we set off for Hidirnebi plateau. This place owes its beauty not only to its abundant rain but also to its humid and foggy weather. Here, we park our car in front of the restaurant and allow you to enjoy your free time for having lunch and sightseeing. We meet again at the specified time and set off towards Sera Lake.

Sera Lake is a landslide-shaped lake located close to the center of Trabzon and it is possible to rent boats on the lake. After we visit Sera Lake, we conclude our tour in Trabzon.

Important things to know before your visit:
  • Pick-up & drop-off only from In front of Zagnos Tour Agency, Trabzon Square & across from the airport.
  • Guest need to be present at the meeting point mentioned above.
  • A Seat number is not given in the vehicle layout plan. You can sit where it is suitable.
  • The vehicle brand and model are not specified. The agency can change vehicles when necessary.
  • The agency has the right to make changes to some points of the program depending on weather, road conditions and season.
  • Our tours are accompanied by group leaders in Turkish, English or Arabic whenever possible. However, no guarantee is given in this regard.
  • The Black Sea region has a climate in which you can experience all four seasons at the same time. We recommend that you check the weather forecast and plan your outfits accordingly.

Start your tour at 10:00 from our office, drive to Cal Cave, and start the tour 30 km from Akcaabat. It is the second-longest cave in the world and has fantastic stalactites and stalagmites, waterfalls, and a small brook running through the chambers. Also, don't miss the medieval castle above the cave.

Then, proceed to the splendid Hidirnebi Plateau. Its foggy air and lush beauty will make it even more memorable. Locally known as "Dernek Çimeni," this is a plateau that represents the peculiar culture of the Black Sea region. Enjoy some free time on land and savor lunch at this restaurant overlooking the enchanting landscape of this place.

Going further, it passes to Sera Lake, a landslide-forming lake in the surroundings of Trabzon, just in the very middle of greenery where one can rent a boat and touch its still waters.

After visiting such unforgettable places, the tour ends in Trabzon, but not without all those natural and cultural miracles staying in one's memory forever.

title: Guided Kayak Tour at Louvre Abu Dhabi
description:
Indulge in an exceptional 1-hour guided kayak adventure as you navigate the picturesque waters around the iconic Louvre Abu Dhabi. Prior to your journey, your instructor will equip you with essential safety insights and tips. Embark on this captivating tour and experience the Louvre Abu Dhabi's remarkable architecture from the tranquil vantage point of your kayak. Immerse yourself in the intersection of art and nature, all while kayaking around the Louvre Abu Dhabi.

Highlights
  • Enjoy the best kayaking experience in Abu Dhabi.
  • Discover iconic global museum architecture from the water.
  • Immerse in a unique blend of culture and natural beauty.

What’s included in the ticket
  • Water
  • A guide

Exclusions
  • Towel
  • Transportation
  • Food

Timings: 
  • The duration of the tour is 1 hour
  • Closed on Mondays


Important things to know before your visit
  • Dress Code: Please come prepared with suitable water activity attire and footwear, as you will likely get wet during the experience.
    We recommend bringing a towel and spare clothing to change into afterward. Restroom facilities are available on-site.
  • To promote sustainability, we no longer provide single-use plastic water bottles.
    Kindly bring your reusable water bottles, as we offer a water dispenser on-site for your convenience.
  • While we encourage you to capture this unique experience with your mobile phone or camera, please be cautious, as electronic devices may accidentally fall into the water.
    We suggest using a waterproof case or taking extra care.
For Dark Night Tour please note the below minimum
  • 4pax to depart
  • 4hrs prior booking must be confirmed

How to get there:
By car:  Louvre Abu Dhabi is located in Al Saadiyat Island, Abu Dhabi, and is easily accessible by car. You can park the car in the museum’s parking free of cost.  

By public transportation: The museum is easily accessible by public transportation with multiple bus routes available from across Abu Dhabi.  

By taxi: You can also take a taxi to the museum from anywhere in Dubai or Abu Dhabi. It’s a popular destination, and most taxi drivers will be familiar with the location. title: Full-Day Ephesus, House of Virgin Mary and Sirince Village Tour
description:
Embark on a journey through time in Ephesus, strolling along its marble streets to uncover the splendor of the Celsus Library and the impressive Ephesus Theatre. Find serenity at the House of the Virgin Mary, nestled amidst verdant hills. Treat your taste buds to a sumptuous local lunch before setting off to Sirince, a picturesque village famous for its wine and quaint stone houses.

Highlights:
  • Exploration of the world-renowned archaeological site of Ephesus with a professional guide.
  • Visiting the peaceful and spiritual site of the House of Virgin Mary.
  • A delightful dining experience with a traditional Turkish lunch.
  • Time to wander and shop in the quaint streets of Sirince Village, famous for its fruit wines and olive oil.

Inclusions:
  • Pick-up and drop-off from Ku≈üadasƒ± hotels.
  • Transportation in a comfortable air-conditioned vehicle.
  • A skilled English-speaking guide who will provide enriching details about each site.
  • A traditional Turkish lunch (excluding beverages).

Exclusions:
  • Entrance fees to the Ephesus archaeological site and the House of Virgin Mary.
  • Beverages during lunch.
  • Personal expenses during the tour.
  • Tips for the guide and driver.

Timing:
  • The tour starts at approximately 09:00 and ends around 17:30

Tour Details:

Begin your morning with a comfortable pickup from your Kusadasi hotel and journey to the ancient city of Ephesus.   As you walk the historical marble streets, marvel at the grandeur of the Celsus Library and the massive Ephesus Theatre. Continue to the House of the Virgin Mary, a site of pilgrimage and serenity nestled in the green hills.   After a delicious local lunch, the day will culminate with a visit to ≈ûirince, a picturesque hillside village known for its wine and charming stone houses.   You'll end your tour with a heart full of memories as we bring you back to your hotel.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Wear comfortable walking shoes due to uneven ancient paths during the tour.
  • Remember to bring sun protection and a water bottle for hydration, especially in warmer weather.
  • Bring extra cash as credit card acceptance may be limited in Sirince for shopping and wine tasting.
  • Please note that this is a shared transfer, and pick-up times may vary. Each hotel has a fixed pick-up time. Kindly wait in the hotel lobby 10 minutes before your scheduled pick-up time.
Embark on an enchanting journey through time as you explore the ancient city of Ephesus, with this full-day Ephesus and House of Virgin Mary tour. Begin your Ephesus day trip from Kusadasi with a comfortable pickup from your Kusadasi hotel, setting off to immerse yourself in the rich tapestry of Ephesus's past.

Wander along its marble streets, tracing the footsteps of ancient civilizations, and marvel at the grandeur of the iconic Celsus Library and the monumental Ephesus Theatre. Delve into the tranquility of the House of the Virgin Mary, tucked away amidst lush hills, where whispers of pilgrimage and serenity echo through the air.  

Indulge your senses with a delectable local lunch before continuing your odyssey with the Sirince village tour, a charming village on picturesque hillsides. Here, amidst quaint stone houses and panoramic views, savor the delights of local wine, soaking in the rustic charm of this idyllic retreat.

As the day draws to a close, bid farewell to Ephesus, carrying cherished memories of a journey through time. Don't miss out on this wonderful adventure with Ephesus day tour!

title: Ephesus Half Day Discovery from Kusadasi
description:
Embark on a guided tour of Ephesus's historic ruins, including the Odeon, Fountain of Trajan, and Scholastica Baths. Stand in awe before the iconic Library of Celsus, a symbol of knowledge. Explore the Temple of Artemis site, once a wonder of the ancient world. Discover early Christianity at Mary's House, where the Virgin Mary is said to have spent her final days. Join us for a journey through history's captivating remnants in Ephesus.

Highlights:
  • A guided tour through the historic ruins of Ephesus, including the Odeon, Fountain of Trajan, and the Scholastica Baths.
  • Stand before the Library of Celsus, the iconic façade that has become a symbol of knowledge and history.
  • The chance to explore the Temple of Artemis site, which once held a wonder of the ancient world.
  • Insights into early Christianity at the remains of Mary's House, where the Virgin Mary is believed to have spent her final days

Inclusions:
  • Round-trip transfer service from Kusadasi hotels.
  • Professional English-speaking tour guide providing historical context along the way.

Exclusions:
  • Entrance fees to the Ephesus archaeological site and the House of Virgin Mary.
  • Beverages during lunch.
  • Personal expenses during the tour.
  • Tips for the guide and driver.

Timing:
  • The tour starts at approximately 09:00 and ends around 13:30

Tour Details:

Set off from the comfort of your Kusadasƒ± hotel and journey back in time with this half-day exploration of Ephesus, one of the best preserved ancient cities in the world.

As you step onto the marble streets where Roman citizens once trod, your knowledgeable guide will bring the city's rich history to life.

Gaze upon the majestic Library of Celsus, the Temple of Artemis one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and the Grand Theatre where the apostle Paul once preached.

You'll return to Kusadasi enriched with history and unforgettable impressions.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Wear comfortable walking shoes due to uneven ancient paths during the tour.
  • Remember to bring sun protection and a water bottle for hydration, especially in warmer weather.
  • Bring extra cash as credit card acceptance may be limited in Sirince for shopping and wine tasting.
  • Please note that this is a shared transfer, and pick-up times may vary. Each hotel has a fixed pick-up time. Kindly wait in the hotel lobby 10 minutes before your scheduled pick-up time.
Join our guided Ephesus half-day tour from Kusadasi, exploring historic ruins like the Odeon, Fountain of Trajan, and Scholastica Baths. Marvel at the iconic Library of Celsus and discover the Temple of Artemis, once a wonder of the ancient world.

Learn about early Christianity at Mary's House and dive into Ephesus's captivating history. Depart from your Kusadasi hotel and journey back in time with our knowledgeable guide, returning enriched with unforgettable impressions.

title: Istanbul Bosphorus Cruise and Spice Bazaar Adventure
description:
Embark on a two-hour Bosphorus cruise and Spice Bazaar exploration in Istanbul. Witness breathtaking views of historic landmarks like Dolmabahce Palace and Ottoman yalƒ±s while indulging in the vibrant atmosphere of the Spice Bazaar. Don't miss the chance to visit the iconic New Mosque for a spiritual and architectural marvel


Highlights:
  • A relaxing, scenic two-hour Bosphorus cruise, showcasing Istanbul’s historic waterfront from a unique perspective
  • Captivating views of the Dolmabahçe Palace, Bosphorus bridges, and Ottoman yalƒ±s (waterside mansions)
  • An engaging exploration of the vibrant Spice Bazaar, brimming with aromatic herbs and exotic spices
  • A visit to the iconic New Mosque (Yeni Camii), famous for its striking architecture and spiritual ambiance

Inclusions:

  • Round-trip transfers from and to the hotel
  • Two-hour Bosphorus cruise on a comfortable tour boat
  • Professional, English-speaking guide to enrich your experience with historical insights and engaging stories

Exclusions:

Tour Details:

Immerse yourself in the vibrant waters of the Istanbul Strait with our Bosphorus Cruise and Spice Bazaar Adventure.

Your journey begins at 09:00 AM with a transfer from your hotel to our awaiting vessel.

Glide along the Bosphorus for two enchanting hours, taking in the historical palaces, fortresses, and mansions that line the shores.

Continue the adventure with a sensory stroll through the Spice Bazaar, followed by a visit to the majestic New Mosque before we escort you back to your hotel.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Participants are advised to dress comfortably and be prepared for varying weather conditions, especially on the cruise where it can be breezier on the water.

Join our Bosphorus Cruise and Spice Bazaar Adventure starting at 09:00 with a hotel transfer. title: Istanbul: Day Trip to Scenic Sapanca, Masukiye and Kartepe
description:
Embark on a full-day adventure from Istanbul to Sapanca, Masukiye, and Kartepe. Marvel at the beauty of Sapanca Lake, stroll through Masukiye's lush forests, and if the season allows, enjoy the snow-capped peaks of Mount Kartepe. With expert guidance, uncover the natural and cultural treasures of these scenic paradises.


Highlights:
  • Soak in the tranquility of Sapanca Lake with opportunities for boating or cycling around its glistening shores.
  • Explore the rustic village of Ma≈üukiye, famous for its natural beauty and delicious local cuisine.
  • Adventure awaits with optional ATV rides or zip-lining experiences in Kartepe (available for an extra fee).
  • When in season, take the chance to ski or simply enjoy a cable car ride to take in the panoramic views atop Mount Kartepe.

Inclusions:

  • Round-trip transportation from Istanbul hotels with a professional driver
  • All-day transportation from Istanbul in a comfortable vehicle.
  • The service of an English-speaking guide knowledgeable about the region's nature and history.

Exclusions:

  • Meals throughout the day.
  • Any optional activities like ATV rides, zip-lining, skiing, or cable car rides in Kartepe.
  • Personal expenses and tips for the guide or driver.

Timing's:
  • The tour starts at approximately 08:30 and ends around 17:30
  • Duration: 08 Hours

Tour Details:

Departing from Istanbul, this full-day tour starts in the cool, early morning and whisks you away to the natural paradises of Sapanca, Masukiye, and Kartepe.

Relish the serenity of Sapanca Lake, wander the peaceful paths of Masukiye's lush forests, and if the season allows, revel in the snow-capped splendour of Mount Kartepe.

Throughout the day, your personal guide will share insights into the unique flora and fauna of these regions, as well as their cultural significance.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Weather can be quite variable in these areas, so dressing in layers is advisable.
  • We alsorecommend that participants bring suitable footwear for outdoor activities.
  • Cameras are a must to capture the stunning vistas.
  • Please ensure to carry sufficient cash, as credit card acceptance may be limited for purchasing optional activities and meals.
Embark on an unforgettable day trip to Sapanca. A journey from Istanbul to the picturesque destinations of Kartepe, Masukiye, and Sapanca. As you depart from the bustling city in the early morning, prepare to immerse yourself in the tranquil beauty of nature's finest offerings in this Sapanca and Masukiye tour.

Your adventure begins at Sapanca Lake, where the serene waters mirror the surrounding verdant landscapes, creating a mesmerizing sight to behold. Continue your exploration as you venture into the lush forests of Masukiye, where verdant foliage envelops winding pathways, offering a refreshing escape from the urban hustle.

If the season permits, ascend to the snow-capped peaks of Mount Kartepe, where a winter wonderland awaits. Revel in the panoramic vistas of pristine white landscapes, indulging in the pure joy of snow-dusted scenery.

Throughout your Sapanca tour from Istanbul, your expert guide will provide fascinating insights into the natural wonders and cultural significance of each destination, enriching your experience and creating cherished memories to last a lifetime.

title: Bursa Day Trip from Istanbul: The Green Treasure
description:
Embark on a enriching day trip to the majestic city of Bursa, known as the Green Treasure, departing from Istanbul hotels. Journey comfortably with our professional guide and driver, crossing the Marmara Sea via ferry or experiencing the grandeur of the Osmangazi Bridge. Step into Ottoman history, visit the Grand Mosque, wander through the Silk Market, and marvel at the Green Mosque. Your return to Istanbul will be filled with cherished memories of exploration


Highlights:
  • Traverse the scenic route with views of the Marmara Sea and rural landscapes.
  • Experience Bursa’s rich heritage with visits to prominent historical sites.
  • Explore the famed Green Mosque and Grand Mosque for a glimpse into Ottoman architecture.
  • Enjoy the lush surroundings and taste local delicacies like chestnut candy and Iskender kebab(optional and not included in the price).

Inclusions:

  • Round-trip transportation from Istanbul hotels with a professional driver
  • All highway and bridge tolls
  • The expertise of an English-speaking guide to provide historical context and personal insights

Exclusions:

  • Meals throughout the tour.
  • Entrance fees to the various attractions and sites.
  • Personal expenses and gratuities

Timing's:
  • The tour starts at approximately 08:30 and ends around 17:30
  • Duration: 08 Hours

Tour Details:

Embark on an enriching day trip to the majestic city of Bursa, known as the Green Treasure, with an early departure from Istanbul hotels at 08:30 AM.

Journey comfortably with our professional guide and driver, crossing the Marmara Sea via ferry or experiencing the grandeur of the Osmangazi Bridge.

Step into Ottoman history, visit the Grand Mosque, wander through the Silk Market, and marvel at the Green Mosque.

Your return to Istanbul will be filled with cherished memories of exploration.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Guests are encouraged to wear comfortable clothing and shoes suitable for walking.
  • The weather can vary, so a hat, sunscreen, or a light jacket might be necessary depending on the season.
  • It's recommended to bring local currency for souvenirs, meals, and entrance fees, as not all places may accept credit cards.
Embark on an enriching Bursa day trip from Istanbul, affectionately known as the Green Treasure in Turkey. Departing from Istanbul hotels in the early morning at 08:30, guests are treated to a comfortable journey to green Bursa led by our expert guide and driver.

Traverse the azure waters of the Marmara Sea, either via ferry for a scenic voyage or across the grandeur of the Osmangazi Bridge, adding a touch of adventure to the excursion. Upon arrival, delve into the rich tapestry of Ottoman history as you explore the city's iconic landmarks.

Marvel at the architectural splendor of the Grand Mosque, an enduring symbol of Bursa's cultural heritage. Lose yourself in the bustling atmosphere of the Silk Market, where vibrant colors and exotic scents evoke the city's historical significance as a center of trade.

Finally, behold the exquisite beauty of the Green Mosque, with its intricately adorned facade and serene ambiance. As the day draws to a close, your return journey to Istanbul is sure to be filled with cherished memories of exploration and discovery of the Bursa day tour.

title: Istanbul Traditional Turkish Bath Experience
description:
Dive into relaxation with our exclusive traditional Turkish Bath Experience in Istanbul. Starting with a pick-up service from your hotel at your scheduled time, you will be smoothly transported to a renowned Turkish hammam in Istanbul. Indulge in the luxury of a traditional Turkish bath ritual including a steam bath, sauna, foam and exfoliating kese scrub, followed by a rejuvenating foam massage within the tranquil ambiance of the historic hammam. Conclude the experience in the serene atmosphere of the salt room before your English-speaking driver ensures your relaxed return to the hotel. Book your experience now and get ready for the best Turkish bath in Istanbul!


Highlights:
  • Authentic Turkish hammam experience with kese and foam massage.
  • Detox and unwind in the sauna and salt room designed for ultimate relaxation.
  • Carefree travel with an English-speaking driver, providing seamless transport to and from the hammam.

Inclusions:

  • Comfortable transport to and from your accommodation.
  • Traditional hammam package including sauna, kese scrub, foam massage, and relaxation in the salt room.

Exclusions:

  • Additional body massage types and treatments which are available for an extra fee.
  • Personal expenses and tips.
  • Food and beverages.

Timing's:
  • Opening Time: 09:00 a.m. to 06:00 p.m.
  • Duration: 01 Hours

Tour Details:

Starting with a pick-up service from your hotel at your scheduled time, you will be smoothly transported to one of Istanbul's renowned hammams.

Indulge in the traditional Turkish bath ritual including a steam bath, sauna, foam and exfoliating kese scrub, followed by a rejuvenating foam massage within the tranquil ambiance of the historic hammam.

Conclude the experience in the serene atmosphere of the salt room before your English-speaking driver ensures your relaxed return to the hotel.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • No guide is necessary for this experience, as you will be attended to by professional hammam staff.
  • We recommend bringing a swimsuit for your comfort and any personal toiletries you may require.
  • Please communicate any preferences or health considerations to your driver or hammam staff to ensure a personalized and safe experience.
Dive into relaxation with our exclusive traditional Turkish Bath Experience in Istanbul. Starting with a pick-up service from your hotel at your scheduled time, you will be smoothly transported to a renowned Turkish hammam in Istanbul.

title: Istanbul Old Town Discovery
description:
Embark on a guided tour through Istanbul's Sultanahmet District, where you'll explore iconic landmarks like the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. Dive into history at the Hippodrome and Basilica Cistern, then step into the opulent world of the Ottoman Empire at Topkapi Palace. Experience the essence of Istanbul's cultural heart in one unforgettable journey.


Highlights:
  • A guided tour of the Sultanahmet District, the cultural heart of the city.
  • An exploration of the majestic Hagia Sophia, a symbol of Istanbul's eclectic history.
  • A visit to the Blue Mosque, renowned for its striking blue ƒ∞znik tiles and unique six minarets.
  • A stroll through the Hippodrome, where political and sporting events were once held during the Byzantine Empire.
  • A stop at the sunken cistern, Basilica Cistern, to witness the ancient engineering marvel.
  • Time to explore the Topkapi Palace, the opulent court of the Ottoman Empire, with its treasury and exotic harem (optional, entry fee not included).

Inclusions:

  • Full-day guided service from a professional, English-speaking local guide.
  • Dedicated vehicle with a professional driver for comfortable transfers between sites.

Exclusions:

  • Meals, drinks, and personal expenses throughout the day.
  • Entry fees to historical sites and museums.
  • Topkapi Palace entrance fee (optional visit).

Timing's:
  • The tour starts at approximately 09:00 and ends around 17:30
  • Duration: 08 Hours

Tour Details:

Embark on a journey through the heart of Istanbul’s historic Old Town.

This is exclusive one-day tour begins at 09:00 AM and promises a full day steeped in history and culture, ending at 5:00 PM.

You will traverse the ancient streets where sultans once walked, explore architectural marvels that have stood for centuries, and soak in the vibrant atmosphere that makes Istanbul's Old Town a UNESCO World Heritage site.


Important things to know before your visit:
  • Guests are advised to wear comfortable shoes and clothing suitable for walking, and be prepared for varying weather conditions.
  • Proper attire is required to enter the Blue Mosque; women should bring a headscarf, and both men and women need to have knees and shoulders covered.
Join us for an enriching exploration of Istanbul's Sultanahmet District, the heart of the city's historic town. Our guided tour will walk you through the captivating stories of iconic landmarks such as the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque while delving into the depths of history at the Hippodrome and Basilica Cistern.

You will also step into the exquisite world of the Ottoman Empire at Topkapi Palace, where tales of grandeur await.

Discover the essence of the old town in Istanbul on this captivating walking tour, starting at 09:00 and unveiling a day rich with historical marvels and cultural treasures, wrapping up at 17:00

As you walk through the ancient streets where sultans once walked, marvel at architectural wonders that have stood the test of time. Enjoy the lively atmosphere of Istanbul's old town, a UNESCO World Heritage site.

title: Cappadocia: Sunset ATV Tour
description:
Embark on an exhilarating ATV excursion that will take you off the beaten path and into the rugged terrain of Cappadocia. Ride through the lunar-like landscapes and towering rock formations.

Embark on an exhilarating ATV excursion that will take you off the beaten path and into the rugged terrain of Cappadocia. Ride through the lunar-like landscapes and towering rock formations.

Experience the thrilling adventure of an ATV tour in the captivating region of Cappadocia. Nestled in the heart of Turkey, Cappadocia is renowned for its unique landscapes, fairy-tale-like rock formations, and ancient cave dwellings.

Embark on an exhilarating ATV (All-Terrain Vehicle) excursion that will take you off the beaten path and into the rugged terrain of this extraordinary destination. Riding an ATV allows you to explore the enchanting valleys, picturesque villages, and hidden trails of Cappadocia in a truly memorable way.

As you rev up your engine, navigate through the surreal lunar-like landscapes, passing by towering rock formations known as "fairy chimneys" that have been shaped by centuries of natural erosion. Feel the adrenaline rush as you speed along dusty trails, cross streams, and conquer challenging terrains under the guidance of experienced and professional instructors.

INCLUDED

  • Professional instructor
  • Safety equipment
  • ATV rental
Embark on a journey unlike any other as you rev up for a Cappadocia sunset quad tour on an ATV. Step into the heart of Turkey's mystique, where rugged terrains meet the whispers of ancient legends.

Explore the surreal beauty of lunar landscapes, where towering rock formations stand as silent sentinels of time. Our guided excursion promises an adrenaline-fueled exploration through hidden valleys, winding trails, and quaint villages nestled amidst the natural wonders of Cappadocia.

Feel the thrill as you conquer dusty paths and cross babbling streams under the expert guidance of our instructors. Experience the magic of Cappadocia as you ride past the legendary 'fairy chimneys,' marveling at their timeless elegance shaped by the whims of nature.

title: Muharraq Cultural Walking Tour
description:
Learn about the history and culture of Bahrain on this walking tour in Muharraq. Your Bahraini guide will tell you stories and facts about Bahrain that you wouldn't find in guidebooks, while taking you on a memory lane of Bahraini culture, history, and traditions. You will visit old traditional homes and learn about the unique architectural designs in Bahrain. Along the way, You will be served traditional snacks, and end the tour in a Bahraini traditional coffee shop you will be able to taste some delicious Arabic coffee, tea and dates. This is a Bahrain must!

 

 

Timing:  

The tour takes 2.5 to 3 hours to finish. The tour runs every day except for Friday and Tuesday. 10 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 7 PM      

Age Restrictions: 

Free entry for kids below 10 years old Learn about the history and culture of Bahrain on this walking tour in Muharraq. title: 75 Minute - The Atlantis Tour - Dubai Marina & Atlantis
description:

Palm Jumeirah

The first landmark you will see during Atlantis The Palm Tour is the Palm Island. There are fascinating villas and five-star hotels including the famous Atlantis Hotel at the pinnacle. We will stop there, so that you can take great photos.


Atlantis

The route of Atlantis Boat Tour Dubai also lies along the well-known Atlantis hotel. It can be considered one of the modern wonders of Dubai for a good reason. It has one of the most expensive rooms in the world and looks incredible from the water.


Dubai Marina

Taking a Boat Trip in Dubai Marina, you'll be amazed at this part of the city's the iconic skyline. The boat cruise will enable you to take a look at luxurious yachts in the dock, and feel the bustling atmosphere of the glistening city. The boat ride will also proceed along the Yacht Club, rich hotels located on the beaches, and a beautiful JBR Walk avenue.


Ain Dubai

The Dubai Marina boat tour proceeds to the Bluewaters Island, one of the newest amongst Dubai's development. It is situated close to Jumeirah Beach and hosts top restaurants, apartments and two hotels.The biggest Ferris wheel in the world, Ain Dubai Ferris wheel is also located on the island.

title: Ski Dubai: Snow Premium with Penguin Encounter
description:
Enjoy the ultimate package with your Ski Dubai Snow Premium Pass tickets, for the most fun-packed day out imaginable. Grab the opportunity to select from Slope Session or Group Lesson. Get ready for a snow-filled adventure with the Ski Dubai Snow Premium Pass! Gain exclusive access to a range of thrilling snow activities including Tobogganing, Bobsled, Tubing Run, Snow Bumpers, Zorb Ball, Chairlift, Mountain Thriller, and the exhilarating Snow Bullet Ride. Dive into the excitement with a 40-minute Penguin Encounter experience included in your pass. Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, enjoy a slope session or a 60-minute Ski/Snowboard Discovery Lesson. With unlimited access to rides from 10 am to 11 pm daily, the Ski Dubai Snow Premium Pass promises a day packed with unforgettable fun. Don't miss out on the offers – book your tickets now!

Timing:

  • Weekdays: 
    Monday - Thursday: 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. (Last ticket is sold at 09:30 p.m.)

    Fridays: 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m. (Last ticket is sold at 10:30 p.m.)

    Weekends: 
    Saturday - Sunday: 09:00 a.m. to 12:00 a.m. (Last ticket is sold at 10:30 p.m.)

    • The penguin encounter is for 40 minutes and is available every half an hour from 12:00 pm-9:00 pm. 
Highlights

  • Enjoy unlimited access to snow rides and attractions and get an adrenaline-pumping experience with Tubing Run, Snow Bumpers, Climbing wall, Zorb ball (Giant ball), Bobsleds, Sliding Hills, Snow Plow Playground, Chairlift, and Mountain Thriller ride
  • After an exhilarating experience, enjoy a delicious meal at the North 28 Restaurant with your free meal voucher
Inclusions:

Unlimited snow fun activities and rides:

  • Tobogganing
  • Bobsled
  • Tubing Run
  • Snow Bumpers
  • Zorb Ball
  • Chairlift
  • Mountain thriller
  • Snow Bullet
  • 40 mins Penguin-Friend Encounter
  • Hot Chocolate
  • Hand warmers, Regular clothing and equipment, jacket, trouser, disposable socks, snow/ski/snowboard boots, and Waterproof gloves will be provided.
  • Helmets are compulsory for children under 13 years old.
  • Locker

Choose any One:

Activity 1: 2 Hours Slope Pass(experienced skier or snowboarder & Skiers/snowboarders must be intermediate level 2 to access the slope)

Activity 2: 1-hour Discovery Lesson (Never Skied or Snowboarded before)

Exclusions:
  • Souvenirs
  • Photos by Cell phones are not allowed
  • Penguin encounter pictures are not included can be purchased at an additional cost
  • Transportation
  • Food and Beverages

Additional Information

Important Update:

Starting on April 27th, 2024, Ski Dubai will be open to visitors again.

Restrictions: 

  • Some rides such as Mountain Thriller, and Snow Bullet Ride are not recommended for senior citizens, pregnant women, or those with back, neck problems, and medical conditions.
  • Guests are not allowed to carry their mobile phones or use the camera inside the penguin encounters.

What to wear: 

  • ‚ÄãYou are advised to wear comfortable and warm clothes.
  • We also recommend you to carry your own cap. 

Child Policy:

  • Children 0-2 years are not allowed to enter Ski Dubai for safety reasons.
  • Children 3 years and above are allowed to enter Ski Dubai with parents/adults.
  • Children under 13 years of age must wear helmets at all times and must be supervised by an adult of 16 years.
  • The minimum age for Ski lessons is 3 years and 8 years for Snowboard lessons.
  • For Giant Ball, the minimum height required for children is 1.0 metres.
  • For Mountain Thriller, the minimum height for children is 1.2 metres.
  • For the Snow Bullet Ride, children 8 years old and above or children with a minimum height of 1.20 m are allowed. Children must be accompanied by adults. The minimum weight required for this ride is 30 kg and the maximum is 120 kg. 
  • For Slope, the minimum requirements without an instructor are at least Intermediate Level 2 for health and safety reasons.

Things to note:

  • We recommend that you make a booking in advance.
  • If you decide to experience the 1-hour discovery lesson, please note that the package offers a group experience for age group categories -3 to 6 years old, 7 to 13 years old, and adults.
  • Helmets are compulsory for children under 13 years old.
  • Please note: Customers are not able to take their own photographs for the safety of our penguins.
