title: The Palm Jumeirah Monorail
description:
The Palm Monorail is the most convenient and enjoyable way to explore all the unique attractions at the Palm Jumeirah. With the Palm Monorail Day Pass you can explore the iconic landmarks at your own pace. One of the must-visit places in Dubai, is the Palm Jumeirah, a magnificent man-made island in the shape of a palm tree and is home to some of the most unique attractions in the city. The best way to explore the Palm Jumeirah is by taking the Monorail, which is both convenient and enjoyable. To start your journey, head to the Gateway Station where you can park your car and hop on the monorail. You can also connect to the Dubai Tram from here. As you ride along, you'll be treated to breathtaking views of the Palm Jumeirah and beyond. The next stop is the Al Ittihad Park station, which is home to various parks and offers a 3.2 km track for the fitness enthusiast. From here, you can also access the Golden Mile Galleria a shopping and dining destination, and Palm West Beach, which is one of Dubai's most beautiful beaches. Here, you can swim, relax, or rent an e-bike to explore the shoreline. The Nakheel Mall Station is another exciting stop, as it provides access to The View at the Palm. This new observation deck offers a 360-degree view of the city's skyline and iconic landmarks like the Burj Al Arab and the Palm Jumeirah. Finally, the last stop is the Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark Station, which is right by the entrance to the Middle East's number one aqua park. Here, you can enjoy various water activities such as snorkelling, diving, and even walking underwater. You can also explore Dubai's largest aquarium, The Lost Chambers, or meet friendly marine mammals at Dolphin Bay and Sea Lion Point. With the Palm Monorail Day Pass, you can plan your day trip at your own pace and explore the iconic landmarks of the Palm Jumeirah. The Palm Monorail in Dubai is the most convenient and enjoyable way to explore all the unique attractions at the Palm Jumeirah. With the Palm Monorail Day Pass, you can explore the iconic landmarks at your own pace.  

The Palm Jumeirah Monorail offers a unique exploration experience, connecting Gateway Station to Atlantis Aquaventure Waterpark Station. Along the ride, visitors can enjoy breathtaking views, access parks, shopping, and dining at the Golden Mile Galleria, and visit the observation deck at The View for 360-degree city vistas.  

The journey also includes stops at beautiful beaches and the Nakheel Mall, culminating at the Middle East's leading aqua park, Atlantis Aquaventure, where guests can engage in water activities and explore marine life.

title: Speedboat Tours Dubai
description:
Embark on a thrilling 45 Mins speed boat tour to Burj Al Arab, Burj Khalifa! Create epic holiday memories! Seize the moment and snap away on our 45 Mins Dubai speed boat tour

Dubai: Speedboat tour to Burj Al Arab & Burj Khalifa


Short Description: Embark on a thrilling 45 Mins speed boat tour to Burj Al Arab, Burj Khalifa! Create epic holiday memories! Seize the moment and snap away on our 45 Mins Dubai speed boat tour.

Long Description: Prepare for a thrilling 45-minute joyride around Dubai, where every moment is filled with excitement and wonder! Step aboard our comfortable boat as we kick off our adventure at the majestic Burj Al Arab – an architectural marvel that crowns Dubai's skyline with unparalleled elegance and grace.

With your camera in hand, get ready to capture the mesmerizing sight of the Burj Khalifa, standing tall and proud against the backdrop of the sea. As the sun casts its golden glow upon the waters, the Burj Khalifa becomes a sight to behold, offering a picture-perfect moment that will remain etched in your memory.

But this isn't just any boat tour – it's an experience filled with laughter, adventure, and unforgettable memories. Whether you're exploring with friends, family, or embarking on a solo adventure, our journey promises to encapsulate the essence of Dubai's iconic landmarks in every snap.

So, seize the opportunity to capture the magic of Dubai in all its glory. Snap away as we glide past iconic landmarks, making the most of every moment on this unforgettable adventure. Your journey through Dubai's most iconic sights may be short, but the memories you create will last a lifetime.

Highlights

Cruise to the iconic Burj Al Arab immersing in their awe-inspiring beauty!

Sail Palm Jumeirah, savor sea views of Burj Khalifa.
Pause for picture-perfect moments with Dubai's iconic landmarks as your backdrop

Smiling tour guide at your service for photos and videos.

Inclusions
  • Bottled water
  • Photo opportunities
  • English and French-speaking guide to give you tips on Dubai's landmarks

Whats not included ?

  • Road Transfers
  • Towels
  • Food

Important things to know before your visit

  • Wear comfortable clothes
  • Sun protection is advisable
  • Children must be aged 5 years and over to take part in this activity
  • Pregnant Women are not allowed on board at any stage of pregnancy for safety reasons.
  • Please bring original proof of ID (passport or Emirates ID) as this is requirement of maritime authorities. Please arrive 15 minutes before the activity starts.

 

Speedboat Dubai: 60 Mins Guided Burj Al Arab & Atlantis Tour

 

Short Description: Embark on a sunset speedboat tour of Dubai. Admire the skyline from the sea as you glide past the Burj Al Arab, Atlantis, and the Burj Khalifa. Cruise along the Palm Jumeirah and enjoy sunset views.

Long Description: You meet us at our marina located near the Jumeirah Beach Hotel, next to the Burj Al Arab. You are greeted by our team, and the captain and the tour guide board you in our Nemo boat, a ribcraft speed boat.

Take a seat in a comfortable speedboat for a full hour of sightseeing around Dubai just before the sunset. The first stop of your tour will be to the Burj Al Arab, the leading emblem of the city.

Once everyone has had the chance to get that perfect picture, the boat will cruise along Palm Jumeirah to its top where you can enjoy the stunning views of Atlantis. You will also have plenty of time to take some nice pictures at this location. On the way back to the marina you can admire Burj Khalifa and the Burj Al Arab from the sea, as you speed towards them.

This is a great way to have a fun time with your friends, family, or by yourself. You will see all of the iconic places in Dubai, and will get the best holidays pictures of your trip to the Emirate.

Highlights

  • Get close up to the Burj Al Arab and Atlantis
  • Cruise along Palm Jumeirah and enjoy stunning views of Burj Khalifa from the sea
  • Stop for the best holidays pictures with Dubai's most famous landmarks in the background
  • Dubai Sunset

Inclusions

  • Bottled water
  • Photo opportunities
  • English and French-speaking guide to give you tips on Dubai's landmarks

Whats not included ?

  • Road Transfers
  • Towels

title: Half-day Snorkeling Boat trip with lunch and drinks from Sharm El Sheikh
description:
Explore Sharm El Sheikh's pristine underwater world on a half-day snorkeling trip from your hotel. Dive into vibrant coral reefs, swim with colorful fish, and enjoy lunch onboard. Discover diverse marine life and birdwatching opportunities, all in a memorable 4-hour experience.

Tour description

  • Get picked up free of charge from your hotel in Sharm El Sheikh for a half-day snorkeling boat trip in the protected natural area.
  • Experience the amazing underwater with its outstanding coral reef. You can swim with the fish or soak up the sun from the upper deck of the boat.
  • The shoreline surrounding the park allows access to over 220 species of rich coral reefs in addition to 1000 species of fish and 40 species of starfish and much more, which attracts divers from all over the world. The area is also a haven for bird watchers as it plays a role in bird migration, serving as a place of rest and nourishment.
  • The half-day boat experience takes about 4 hours with lunch and drinks including two snorkeling stops.
  • Following this memorable experience, your boat will take you back to the marina where you will board your coach to drive you back to your hotel.

title: Luxor Deluxe guided tour from Hurghada
description:

Indulge in a set menu lunch at a 5-star hotel before visiting the Valley of the Kings, where you can enter three of its royal tombs. Return to your accommodation in Hurghada at the end of the day, cherishing unforgettable memories of your Luxor adventure.

Tour description

  • Next, you’ll have a set menu lunch at a 5-star hotel to meet your expectations before heading to the Valley of the Kings. You’ll get to enter three of its 63 royal tombs. Then, take in the ancient Mortuary Temple of Hatshepsut, and the staggering Colossi of Memnon, where you will have a jam-packed day of temples, tombs, and monuments that sweep you through thousands of years of history.

description:

The function of this outstanding construction was to enable drinking water for Hagia Sophia. The great Palace of Palatium Magnum and fountains and baths are located throughout the city.

It is located in the heart of the historic city center. It is the giant cistern in the historical city of Istanbul. The Cistern is hosting 336 columns. Located in the heart of Istanbul's historic city center, the Basilica Cistern is a monumental underground structure. Hosting 336 columns, this remarkable construction's primary function was to provide drinking water for Hagia Sophia and the Great Palace of Palatium Magnum, along with various fountains and baths scattered throughout the city.  

To visit, ensure you have your Basilica Cistern entry ticket, as well as information on the entry fee and museum details. This ancient marvel offers a glimpse into Istanbul's architectural and engineering heritage, making it a must-see attraction for history enthusiasts and tourists alike.

title: Bosphorus Boat Cruise Istanbul
description:
Bosphorus, also recognized as the Strait of Istanbul, is a tight, natural strait and a globally famous waterway located in northwestern Turkey. It can also be pronounced as Bosphorus Strait. If you want to enjoy the Bosphorus in a relatively short time, it is the best choice for you. The tour starts from the Eminonu port and returns to the same place after a cruise to the second bridge in the Bosphorus.
  • Experience a Bosphorus cruise starting from Eminonu port, passing iconic landmarks like Dolmabahce Palace, Ciragan Palace, and the Bosphorus Bridge.
  • Witness historical sites such as Rumeli Fortress and Beylerbeyi Palace, with informative insights on their significance and history.
  • Enjoy the scenic views of the Bosphorus while learning about the architectural marvels and stories behind Maiden's Tower and other notable attractions.


There are three bridges in the Bosphorus and the second one or Fatih Sultan Mehmet Bridge, is half-way from the Sea of Marmara to the Black Sea.
On this cruise, you will see some of the most iconic places of the Bosphorus. After you start from the Eminonu port, the first highlight is the Dolmabahce Palace. Dolmabahce Palace was the residence of the royal family after the Topkapi Palace and it was built in the 19th century with the order of Sultan Abdulmecid. It was also the place that the founder of the Republic of Turkey, Mustafa Kemal Ataturk was using as a presidential palace and he died here in the year 1938. Today Dolmabahce Palace functions as a museum. After the Dolmabahce Palace, the second palace is Ciragan Palace. Ciragan means light and this was the secondary palace in the 19th century. After a big fire in 1910, the palace needed an extensive renovation and a hotel group did it. Today the building is on a lease from the government for 49 years and functions as a hotel.

Departure Point

Bosphorus Cruise departs from Eminonu Turyol Port

On this Bosphorus boat cruise, you will see some of Istanbul's most iconic landmarks. Departing from the Eminonu port, your first highlight is Dolmabahce Palace.

Built in the 19th century by the order of Sultan Abdulmecid, it served as the residence of the royal family after Topkapi Palace. Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, the founder of the Republic of Turkey, used it as a presidential palace and passed away here in 1938. Today, Dolmabahce Palace functions as a museum.  

Next on the tour is Ciragan Palace. The name "Ciragan" means light, and this secondary palace of the 19th century underwent extensive renovations after a major fire in 1910. Now, it operates as a hotel, leased from the government for 49 years.  

Join us for a memorable Bosphorus boat cruise in Istanbul, Turkey, and experience these historic sites from a unique perspective on the water.

description:

The buffet features an extensive range of dishes from around the world, each one crafted to perfection and bursting with unique flavours that will tantalize your taste buds. Whether you're in the mood for comforting Chinese dim sum, authentic Indian curries, delightful Italian pasta, or exquisite French pastries, Kaleidoscope has it all. How to get there:

By car: Atlantis The Palm is easily accessible by car. If you are driving to the park, you can drive all the way up to Palm Jumeirah and follow the signs for Atlantis The Palm.  

By public transportation: The hotel is easily accessible by public transportation. You can take the metro to the Mall of the Emirates station, then hail a taxi directly to the park.

title: Jack The Ripper Tour London
description:
It is the autumn of 1888, and a sinister serial killer is loose on the streets of London‚Äôs East End. At first he is known simply as ‚ÄòThe Whitechapel Murderer‚Äô. But in time, thanks to a mysterious letter sent to a London news agency (a copy of which you will be shown in the course of the walk), he will become known as ‚ÄòJack the Ripper,‚Äô in which capacity his name will become famous throughout the world

We will take you on a 2 hour London Jack the Ripper walking tour through the dark and narrow streets of London’s famous Victorian East End.
We will trace the footsteps and crime scenes of the murders Jack the Ripper committed. Some London tours (such as this) are not for the faint hearted!

We will spend our time in the East End of London : Aldgate and Whitechapel areas. The route that our Jack the Ripper tour takes is designed to follow the murders in sequence.

This part of London borders the current square mile (financial district)

 

The area is steeped in history and as well as following the murders Jack the Ripper committed we will also give you small pieces of information regarding the history of the area

 

Learn more about the first serial killer the world has ever known on this London guided tour, and see if you can solve the crime.

What’s included:

  • Fun Local Guide
  • Learn about Jack the Ripper (Try and solve the crime)

Please bring with you:

  • An umbrella if it’s raining
  • Comfy Shoes
  • Drinks & Snacks
  • Camera (for all the photos you’ll be taking!)
Where we meet
  • We meet outside the Whitechapel Gallery. Nearest train station is Aldgate East.

 

Further details will be sent the day before the tour.

In the autumn of 1888, a sinister figure terrorized London’s East End. Initially known as ‘The Whitechapel Murderer,’ he soon gained worldwide notoriety as ‘Jack the Ripper,’ thanks to a mysterious letter sent to a London news agency—a copy of which you'll see on our tour.  

Join us for a 2-hour Jack the Ripper London walking tour, navigating the dark, narrow streets of the Victorian East End. Led by an experienced tour guide, you'll trace the steps and explore the murder scenes of Jack the Ripper. This walk is not for the faint-hearted!  

We’ll delve into the heart of the East End, focusing on Aldgate and Whitechapel. The tour route is designed to follow the sequence of the Jack the Ripper murders, offering a chillingly immersive Jack the Ripper experience. For those intrigued by history's darker side, our Jack the Ripper museum tours offer deeper insights. You’ll also have the opportunity to visit the Whitechapel Jack the Ripper Museum to explore the story of these unsolved crimes.  

Join us for a day tour that brings to life this eerie chapter of London’s history, unraveling the mysteries behind one of England's most infamous serial killers.

title: Visit The Houses of Parliament & 3 Hour Westminster Walking Tour
description:
Discover over 20 of London's most iconic sights in a 3-hour historic walking tour, starting from Green Park and winding through Westminster. Highlights include Buckingham Palace, Downing Street, and the majestic Westminster Abbey, where centuries of royal ceremonies have unfolded. Join us for an unforgettable journey through London's history with expert guides by your side. Tour Description

Join our fantastic 3-hour London walking tour where you will see the very best sights of Westminster before entering the spectacular Palace of Westminster – home to the UK Parliament and with over 1000 years of history!

We start in Green Park & then head to Westminster. Along the way, your local London guide will show you sights including Buckingham Palace, Downing Street, Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, The London Eye and Parliament Square. During June and July, you can even see the Changing of the Guard (10am tour only)!

After your walking tour, you’ll enter the famous Palace of Westminster – home to the House of Commons and the House of Lords, the two houses of the Parliament of the United Kingdom. This is where Britain’s biggest decisions have been made for centuries!

The multimedia guide contains both audio commentary and video content and allows you to go at your own pace. You should allow up to 90 minutes for the tour.

You can choose from a range of languages when you arrive. If you have any questions, there are Visitor Assistants along the tour route to help.

Inclusions

  • Entrance ticket & audio tour of the Palace of Westminster
  • Fun Local Guide
  • Top Westminster Sights of London
  • Small Tour Group Size

Exclusions

  • An umbrella if its raining
  • Comfortable Shoes
  • Drinks & Snacks
  • Camera (for all the photos you’ll be taking!)

Meeting Point
  • We meet outside the Ritz Hotel (W1J 9BR). Next to two red telephone boxes. The nearest underground station is Green Park.
Step into the heart of London’s history with our exclusive 3-hour guided walking tour, beginning at Green Park and leading you through the iconic landmarks of Westminster. Marvel at Buckingham Palace, the official residence of the British monarch, before heading to Downing Street, home of the UK Prime Minister. Hear fascinating tales of royal ceremonies at the majestic Westminster Abbey, an architectural masterpiece steeped in over a thousand years of history.  

Your expert local guide will lead you past Big Ben, the iconic clock tower, and Parliament Square, where you'll learn about the Houses of Parliament, the epicenter of British governance. During June and July, the 10am tour offers the chance to witness the spectacular Changing of the Guard.  

Following the walking tour, step inside the historic Palace of Westminster, where the House of Commons and House of Lords convene to debate and decide the nation’s laws. Explore at your own pace with a multimedia guide that includes audio commentary and video content, ensuring an immersive experience.  

Choose from multiple languages for your tour and enjoy the assistance of Visitor Assistants along the route. This unforgettable journey through London’s political and royal heritage is not to be missed!  

Discover the history of the Houses of Parliament and more on our guided tour of this iconic London landmark.

title: Eat 8 English Foods & See 30+ London Sights Walking Tour!
description:
This is a London Food Tour where you will see the top 30 London Sights & eat the best of British food. Along the way you will hear funny & interesting stories about the buildings, statues, monuments & history of London.

Tour Discription


This is a nicely paced 6 hour London walking foodie tour in a small group. We walk around two of London’s most famous areas of Westminster & Southwark (London Bridge area) before spending one hour in Borough Market, the most famous food market in London!

  • We start in Green Park & head to Buckingham Palace where we will get great photos of the Queen’s Formal residence in London & also see the magnificent Changing of the Guard.
  • After watching this impressive display we then head up the Royal Mall, through Trafalgar Square and down Whitehall, finishing up in Parliament Square. Sights we see along the way include : The Queen’s Life Guards (Bodyguard), Downing Street, Nelson’s Column, A Harry Potter site, Westminster Abbey & The Houses of Parliament (Westminster Palace & Big Ben) Plus many many more!
  • Next Stop : the London Bridge area. Sights you will see here include Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, The Shard, HMS Belfast, Tower Bridge, London Bridge and the Tower of London.
  • After working up an appetite we finish at Borough Market where we feast on Great British Food! 
  • Foods include : Fish & Chips (maybe mushy peas if you like them….), Pie & Mash,  Scotch Egg & a very famous Donut. Plus a famous English Beer

This is one of the best London Food Tours!  


Note: Changing of the Guard will take place daily in June & July, otherwise only on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. 10am tour only


What’s included:

  • Fun Local Guide
  • 30 + Top sights of London
  • Great British Food menu
  • Small Tour Group Size (10 – 15 guests per group)

Please bring with you:

  • An umbrella if it’s raining
  • Comfy Shoes
  • Drinks & Snacks
  • Contactless Bank Card, Topped up Oyster / Travel Card for the Underground journey
  • Camera (for all the photos you’ll be taking!)

Where we meet:    
  • We meet outside the Ritz Hotel (W1J 9BR). Next to two red telephone boxes. Nearest underground station is Green Park.
Join the ultimate London Food Tour, exploring 30 top sights and savoring the best of British cuisine!  

Discover funny and fascinating stories about London's buildings, statues, and history while enjoying a leisurely 6-hour walking tour in a small group. Begin in Green Park, capturing photos of Buckingham Palace and witnessing the Changing of the Guard.  

Follow the Royal Mall, Trafalgar Square, and Whitehall to Parliament Square, passing iconic landmarks like the Queen’s Life Guards, Downing Street, Nelson’s Column, and a Harry Potter site, among others. Then, explore the London Bridge area with sights such as Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, The Shard, HMS Belfast, Tower Bridge, London Bridge, and the Tower of London.  

Wrap up at Borough Market, London's most famous food market, where you'll feast on traditional British dishes including Fish & Chips, Pie & Mash, Scotch Egg, and a famous Donut, and enjoy a pint of English beer. Experience one of the best London Food Tours, blending sightseeing with delicious local flavors!

title: Bosphorus Yacht Cruise with Stopover on Asian Side
description:
Set sail on a cruise between Europe and Asia on Istanbul's Bosphorus Strait.
Set sail on a cruise between Europe and Asia on Istanbul's Bosphorus Strait. See the wonders of both East and West from the water while accompanied by a multilingual guide. Stopover on the Asian side and explore Kanlica, a district that stands in defiance of time. On board the yacht, hear stories of this mesmerizing city as you set out to pass sights on both continents, including Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, the Leander Tower, and Istanbul's most posh areas, Ortakoy and Bebek. Pass under the two suspended Bosphorus bridges that connect Europe and Asia and Admire the thick walls of the medieval Rumeli Fortress. Snap photos of the city skyline and hear about the confluence of cultures that exists at this meeting point between Europe and Asia. During this 2.5-Hours cruise, you'll be free to wander between decks to capture the best shots of Istanbul's attractions. Your guide will illustrate the history of what you see during the cruise; Bosphorus has a storied past and your guides know the fun facts you can't find in a tourist handbook. The Bosphorus separating two continents has always been crucial to life in Istanbul. Once a prime channel to move fearsome armies through, it now serves more peaceful functions. Seeing this important trading route is a must-do for travelers. Set sail on a cruise between Europe and Asia on Istanbul's Bosphorus Strait with Bosphorus Sightseeing Cruise. title: Bosphorus Sunset Cruise on a Luxurious Yacht
description:
Take a sunset cruise on the Bosphorus Strait to see the European as well as Asian half of Istanbul

Take a sunset cruise on the Bosphorus Strait to see the European as well as Asian half of Istanbul. Jump aboard a luxury yacht from Kabatas and keep your cameras ready as you cross mosques, palaces, and seafront villas. Learn about the city’s centuries-long history through your guide. Start the tour at Kabatas Pier aboard an elegant yacht, drinking traditional Turkish drinks, and nibbling on canapés and fruit from tastefully arranged platters. Glide by palaces and minarets as you sail along the Bosphorus.  When dusk sets in, feel the soothing breeze from the Sea of Marmara on your skin as the sky puts on a colorful show, tinted with shades of orange and rose. Few places in the world are as mesmerizing as Istanbul in the setting sun.

Hear the muezzin's call from a towering minaret. Cruise past majestic palaces and villas along the strait’s banks. Breathe in the legacy of ancient Byzantium, Constantinople, and the mighty Ottoman Empire with each breath of fresh salty air. Kick back and ride gentle waves in the comfort of a yacht. Watch the city and its iconic landmarks pass by, which is the perfect way to unwind after a busy day of sightseeing. End the experience at the same pier Kabata≈ü. Experience the beauty of Istanbul on a Bosphorus sunset cruise. Sail on a luxurious yacht, enjoying stunning views of mosques, palaces, and villas. Learn about the city's history from your guide while sipping traditional Turkish drinks and nibbling on delicious snacks.

Feel the calming sea breeze as the sky turns shades of orange and rose at dusk. Listen to the call to prayer from towering minarets and soak in the rich history of Istanbul. Relax and unwind as you glide along the gentle waves, taking in the iconic landmarks of the city.

End your journey back at Kabata≈ü Pier, cherishing the memories of the best Bosphorus sunset cruise.

description:

title: The London Top Sights Tour. Kids Free!
description:
With over 30 world-famous landmarks, this is the ultimate London walking tour!

Highlights


We start in Westminster, where we will head through Green Park to Buckingham Palace, where we’ll watch the world-famous Changing of the Guard ceremony (certain days only). 

We’ll then head up the Royal Mall, past Prince Charles’ house (Clarence House) and on to Trafalgar Square. We will gaze up at Admiral Nelson and then head down Whitehall, past Downing street, to Parliament Square. Sights we’ll see along the way include Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, and the Houses of Parliament.

We then head to the London Bridge start our tour on London Bridge area and walk toward Southwark on the South Bank. You will get to see Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, HMS Belfast, Tower Bridge, and the Tower of London plus many other sights along the way!

NOTE: Changing of the Guard will take place daily in June & July, otherwise only on Mondays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays. 10am tour only.

Kids under 12 are free! Please let us know how many kids you’ll be bringing when booking 


What’s included

  • Fun Local Guide
  • 30+ Top sights of London
  • Small Tour Group Size (10 – 15 guests per group)

 

Please bring with you

  • An umbrella if its raining
  • Comfortable Shoes
  • Drinks & Snacks

  • Camera (for all the photos you’ll be taking!)

 


Where we meet

 We meet outside the Ritz Hotel (W1J 9BR). Next to two red telephone boxes. Nearest underground station is Green Park.

 

Join our day walking tour in London, starting in Westminster. We'll stroll through Green Park to Buckingham Palace, catching the world-famous Changing of the Guard ceremony (on certain days).  

Continuing up the Royal Mall, past Prince Charles’ residence (Clarence House), we'll reach Trafalgar Square. Here, we'll marvel at Admiral Nelson's statue before heading down Whitehall, passing Downing Street, en route to Parliament Square. Along the way, we'll admire Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, and the Houses of Parliament.  

Next, we'll journey to the London Bridge area to start our guided walking tour of London. We'll walk towards Southwark on the South Bank, taking in sights like Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre, HMS Belfast, Tower Bridge, and the Tower of London, among other landmarks along the way!   Don't miss this London top sights tour that covers all the must-see sights in the heart of the city.

title: Topkapi Palace & Harem Tour with Historian Guide
description:
Learn all about Istanbul‚Äôs Ottoman heritage, and visit one of the city‚Äôs top landmarks, on this small-group tour of the Topkapi Palace and the Harem chambers. Avoid the queues with fast track entry and explore the sprawling 15th Century palace and its expansive museum with an expert guide.
  • Discover the private world of the Ottoman sultans
  • Explore a sprawling UNESCO World Heritage site
  • Learn about the fascinating history of the palace from an expert guide
  • Admire the elaborate mosaics and colorful windows of the Harem chambers
  • Avoid the long queues with fast-track entry

Learn all about Istanbul’s Ottoman heritage, and visit one of the city’s top landmarks, on this small-group tour of the Topkapi Palace and the Harem chambers. Avoid the queues with fast track entry and explore the sprawling 15th Century palace and its expansive museum with an expert guide. Explore the extensive complex that winds down towards the Bosphorus. The palace itself is a balance of huge courtyards, cavernous council chambers and winding secret passageways, which were built to ensure the Ottoman sultans and their families could enjoy maximum privacy and discretion. A highlight of the tour is the Imperial Harem, comprising over 400 chambers in one of the sultan’s private apartments. The rooms are characterized by colorful mosaic floors and stained glass windows, and provide incredible insight into the private world of the Ottoman court.

Inclusions 

  • Topkapi Palace & Harem tickets
  • Historian guide
  • Fast track entry

Exclusions

  • Pickup and dropoff
  • Food and drink

Important things to know before you visit
  • The tour duration is 1.5 hours
  • Please note that the tour is wheelchair accessible
How to get there

By public transportation: You can get on the T1 Bagcilar-Kabatas tramline and get off at Sultanahmet stop. You can reach Topkapi Palace after a short walk.

By taxi: Topkapi Palace is one of the most popular destinations in Istanbul. You can easily access it by taking a taxi if you don't prefer to use public transportation.

Free Cancelation

Cancel up to 24 hours in advance for a full refund Discover Istanbul’s rich Ottoman heritage on an exclusive small-group tour of the Topkapi Palace and Harem rooms. With fast-track entry, bypass the queues and dive straight into the grandeur of this sprawling 15th-century palace and its vast museum, guided by an expert.

Wander through the extensive complex, stretching down to the Bosphorus, where grand courtyards, majestic council chambers, and hidden passageways reveal the secrets of the Ottoman sultans' lives.   

The tour's highlight is the Imperial Harem, boasting over 400 chambers within the sultan’s private quarters. Topkapi Harem rooms, adorned with vibrant mosaic floors and intricate stained glass windows, offer a fascinating glimpse into the opulent and secluded world of the Ottoman court.

Secure your spot now for an unforgettable journey through one of Istanbul's most iconic landmarks.

title: Vialand Theme Park Ticket & Shuttle
description:
What makes Vialand Theme Park Istanbul amazing is that it is not only a theme and amusement park, but also a huge complex that combines theme park, shopping, entertainment and exhibition centers in one place.



Highlights

  • The world’s 4th best Roller Coaster named “Nefeskesen (Breathtaking), that reaches to 110 km/hrs speed in just 3 seconds.
  • The Crazy River (Cilgin Nehir), an unforgettable adventure along a 700 meters river and a waterfall.
  • The Justice Tower (Adalet Kulesi), an extreme landing with full adrenaline from 50 meters.
  • The 360, that you look around while your head is down, from 28 meters.
  • The attractions such as Viking (a water adventure) and King Kong (you are on the hands of King Kong, 15 meters from the ground).
  • You can enjoy the spectacular and magical world of Vialand Theme Park with your family and friends. Have fun on the world’s 4th biggest roller-coaster, as well variety of great rides and thrills. You can also have some leisure time to explore the shopping mall of the park.

What makes Vialand Theme Park Istanbul amazing is that it is not only a theme and amusement park, but also a huge complex that combines theme park, shopping, entertainment and exhibition centers in one place.

And that allows families to spend a great time here while their kids have fun at the variety of the attractions such as thrills, rides, roller-coasters and carousels and they can spend time at the shopping center, themed streets, great boutiques, festival and event areas, restaurants and cafes.

The huge shopping center also houses an indoor zoo named “Jungle” apart from the theme park.

We can say that you and your kids may spend the whole day at Vialand without getting bored. No chance. It is the best place in Istanbul for kids.l different from the other theme parks?

The complex covers and area of 600.000 m2 which is very very huge. Its combination of both being a big shopping and amusement center is unique worldwide. That’s why the park is the most popular point of interest in Istanbul for all ages.

The shopping center of Vialand is not like the classic ones in all over the world, it houses more than 200 stores along its three-storey open and closed shopping streets with a nostalgic tram operating in between.

Vialand has been listed on the top 10 Theme Parks in the World and gained European Star Award 2016 amongst the 800 theme parks in the world.

Important things to know before your visit

  • For tourists, we recommend you to visit Vialand in the weekdays if possible. Majority of the locals visit the park at the weekends and the park becomes very crowded.
  • You are entering the theme park with your ticket and inside you are free to take all the park rides and attractions for free. You don’t have to buy any tickets inside which is very easy to spend the day without making calculations.
  • Make sure you keep your ticket until you leave the park that you may be asked for your ticket during your visit.
  • We recommend you to visit the theme park with comfortable/sports shoes and with a cap for the summer months
How to Get There?

 

By free shuttle busses from Taksim Square - Sirkeci - Sultanahmet

Discover the magic of Istanbul theme park Vialand, where adventure and excitement await you and your family. Not just an amusement park, Vialand is a massive complex that combines thrilling rides, roller coasters, and carousels with an incredible shopping and entertainment experience.

As your kids delight in the variety of attractions, you can explore themed streets, exquisite boutiques, and a wide array of restaurants and cafes, ensuring everyone has a fantastic time. Spanning 600,000 square meters, Vialand offers something truly unique.

Wander through the three-story shopping center, featuring over 200 stores and a nostalgic tram service that adds a touch of charm to your shopping spree. Don’t miss the indoor zoo, "Jungle," which provides a fascinating break from the rides.

Vialand's blend of amusement and shopping makes it a standout destination, recognized globally and awarded the European Star Award in 2016. Join us for an unforgettable day of fun, adventure, and exploration at Vialand Theme Park Istanbul, Turkey.

description:

Cruise around the city‚Äôs iconic Corniche waterfront and see the beautiful West Bay skyline then head to the modern and luxurious island development known as the Pearl.

  OLD ISTANBUL SEGWAY CITY TOUR

 You have never seen so much in only 3 hours!

The Old City Tour covers best points of interest within Istanbul. Then you head to the Sultanahmet Mosque also known as Blue Mosque. Right after seeing the primary residence of Ottoman Sultans Topkapi Palace, you will continue to the Hagia Sophia, as known as Church of Holy Wisdom, which is richly and artistically decorated by Byzantine Emperor Justinian. We will stop in Gulhane Park, which is the oldest and largest urban park in Istanbul, and we will take a break. Then we will move throughout Constantine's Column (Cemberlitas), one of the most prominent examples of Roman art before arriving at Beyazƒ±t Square and Mosque. Then we will visit ≈ûehzade Mosque, which is considered by architectural historians as Sinan's first masterpiece. Right after seeing famous Bozdoƒüan Aqueduct, we will continue to the largest mosque of Istanbul Suleymaniye Mosque, the mosque of Sultan Süleyman the magnificent. Tour will finish at meeting point.

 Alemdar Mahallesi, Çatalçe≈üme Sokak, Üretmen Han No29/5-6 34110, Fatih The Segway City Tour covers Istanbul's top points of interest, starting in the historic Sultanahmet district. Next, visit the iconic Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet Mosque) with its stunning architecture. Continue to Topkapi Palace, the opulent primary residence of Ottoman sultans, before exploring the richly adorned Hagia Sophia, originally built by Byzantine Emperor Justinian.

You'll also see the historic Bozdoƒüan Aqueduct before arriving at the grand Suleymaniye Mosque, built for Sultan Süleyman the Magnificent. The Segway Tour Istanbul concludes back at the starting point.

title: Thames Cruise: Tower Bridge (Butler's Wharf Pier) To Greenwich with optional return
description:
Choose a one-way trip to Greenwich or opt for a round-trip cruise and enjoy uninterrupted views over riverside landmarks including Tower Bridge and Canary Wharf. Join our crew for a sightseeing tour starting at Tower Bridge Quay and cruising to Greenwich Pier. After exploring Tower Bridge and the Tower of London, board our vessels for a cruise of admiring famous landmarks such as Cutty Shark, the Houses of Parliament, and more. During your tour, enjoy panoramic and uninterrupted views from our enclosed lower decks or open-air upper decks as you cruise along the River Thames. Experience a unique perspective, grab a beverage and snack from our fully licenced bars, and sit back as our local skippers provide entertaining information about London‚Äôs history and its famous sights.

  • One-way or a round-trip ticket for the Thames Cruise from Westminster to Greenwich

Exclusions:

Tower Bridge ()Butler's Wharf Pier

Tower Bridge (Butler’s Wharf Pier) offers a memorable stop with its mix of heritage and modern charm. Once a busy trading hub, it’s now home to trendy restaurants, bars, and stylish apartments. Take a leisurely walk along the riverbank and enjoy stunning views of Tower Bridge and the city skyline. Don’t forget to visit the Tower Bridge Museum to learn about its fascinating history and across the bridge, you’ll find the famous Tower of London, home to the Crown Jewels. Just a short walk along the southern bank of the river, you can also visit the Second World War warship HMS Belfast, which is now a museum about life onboard during a conflict.

Greenwich Pier Greenwich Pier is well-placed for tourists hoping to explore the maritime area of Greenwich. In this area, explore sights like Cutty Sark, Greenwich Market, the National Maritime Museum, the Old Royal Naval College, and Queen’s House.

Important Things to know before you visit:

Can Travellers disembark at Greenwich Pier and get a later boat Back?
Yes. Always confirm with the ticket office or crew as to the time of the last boat.

What is the total Journey time from Tower Bridge (Butlers Wharf Pier) into Greenwich Pier?
The Journey time from Tower Bridge (Butlers Wharf Pier) into Greenwich Pier is 25 Minutes. 

Do you Sell food or Drinks On Board?
Yes we have a fully licensed bars selling a wide range of tasty snacks and drinks, Both non alcholic and alcholic. 

What attractions and activities are there to enjoy in greenwich?
The top attractions and activities in Greenwich include the Cutty Sark, Greenwich Royal Observatory, and Greenwich Market. You can find more details on our Attractions page.

Opt for a one-way trip from Tower Bridge to Greenwich by boat or enjoy a round-trip cruise for uninterrupted views of landmarks like Tower Bridge and Canary Wharf.  

Embark on a sightseeing tour with us starting at Tower Bridge Quay, cruising to Greenwich Pier. After exploring Tower Bridge and the Tower of London, hop on our river boat to see iconic sights such as Cutty Sark and the Houses of Parliament. If you prefer a stroll, the Tower Bridge to Greenwich walk along the Thames is a scenic option. Join us for an unforgettable journey from Butler's Wharf Pier to Greenwich.

title: Guided Tour: Best of Istanbul Full Day Tour
description:
Discover Istanbul's most iconic sights on a tour.



Highlights

  • Visit all the main tourist attractions of Istanbul in one day

  • Visit the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and Hagia Sophia

  • Learn about the history of Istanbul as you explore its historic sites

  • Stop at a local Turkish restaurant to savor an authentic lunch

  • Navigate the maze-like interior of the Grand Bazaar's shops


Tour description

Discover Istanbul's most iconic sights on a tour. Listen to your guide recount tales of the city's colorful past as you pass by landmarks such as the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, and Hippodrome. Round off the experience with a visit to the Grand Bazaar, one of the oldest covered markets in the world.

Start your tour at the Hippodrome of Constantinople, which was the sports and social center of the old city. Discover major artworks including the Obelisk from Egypt, the Serpentine Column from Delphi, and the fountain of Willhelm II. 

Then, continue to the Blue Mosque, whose 6 minarets adorn Istanbul’s skyline. Next up is the Topkapi Palace, which was home to Ottoman emperors between the 15th and 19th centuries. 

Marvel at the jewel-stuffed treasury, the Ottoman Empire's imperial collections, and priceless displays of Oriental porcelain. If the Topkapi Palace is closed on your trip date, you'll visit the Nakkas Cistern instead.

Continue to the Hagia Sophia Mosque, a monument of equal significance to the Byzantine and Ottoman Empires. Behold the dome and stunning mosaics of this architectural gem as your guide recounts its turbulent history. Then, enter the Grand Bazaar with over 3,000 shops selling everything from carpets to jewelry to ceramics and leather goods. Take a stroll around the Bazaar and soak in the aroma of different spices, dried fruits, nuts, sweets, and lokum (Turkish Delights). Tour ends in Grand Bazaar.

 

Includes

  • Hotel pickup from centrally located hotels
  • Transportation for Pick up service
  • Professional Licenced English Speaking Tour Guide
  • Lunch at a local restaurant
  • Headset/infoport for groups more than 8 people
  • Topkapi Palace entry fee (1500TL Per person to be paid in cash)
  • Hagia Sophia entry fee (25 € EUR Per person to be paid in cash)

Pickup points

Nordstern Hotel Galata, Hagia Sophia Museum, Sofitel Istanbul Taksim, Ciragan Palace Kempinski, Grand Hyatt Istanbul, Port Bosphorus Hotel, Legacy Ottoman Hotel, Conrad Istanbul Bosphorus, W Hotel, InterContinental Istanbul, Pera Palace Hotel, Hilton Istanbul Bosphorus, Galata Port Istanbul, Hagia Sophia Entrance Gate

Important things to know before your visit

  • Topkapi Palace is closed every Tuesday and is replaced with Basilica Cistern

  • Inner parts of Grand Bazaar are closed every Sunday

  • The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are unable to be visited during prayer times and special events

  • Tour ends in Grand Bazaar

    Free Cancelation 
    Cancel up to 24 hours in advance for a full refund

Discover Istanbul's most iconic sights on a Full Day Istanbul Tour. Listen to your guide recount tales of the city's past as you pass by landmarks such as the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, and Hippodrome. Start your tour at the Hippodrome, which was the sports and social center of the old city. 

Then, continue to the Blue Mosque, whose 6 minarets adorn Istanbul’s skyline. Next up is the Topkapi Palace, which was home to Ottoman emperors between the 15th and 19th centuries. If the Topkapi Palace is closed on your trip date, you'll visit the Nakkas Cistern instead.

Continue to the Hagia Sophia Mosque, a monument of equal significance to the Byzantine and Ottoman Empires. Then, enter the Grand Bazaar with over 3,000 shops selling everything from carpets to jewelry to ceramics and leather goods.

Take a stroll around the Bazaar and soak in the aroma of different spices, dried fruits, nuts, sweets, and lokum (Turkish Delights). Conclude your Full Day Istanbul City Tour in Grand Bazaar and cherish the memories of a day full of wonder.

description:

  • Enjoy a hassle-free visit with a roundtrip-shuttle bus from Sultanahmet Square

Explore the Istanbul Aquarium, housing 1,500 species from all over the world, with this time-saving entry ticket and roundtrip transfer service from Sultanahmet Square.   Board the bus in the heart of Sultanahmet Square and enjoy hassle-free access to this popular attraction. Enter the aquarium quickly and easily without having to wait in line.   Discover over 17,000 sea and land creatures in the magical underwater world of Istanbul Aquarium. Say hello to the myriad of inhabitants by following a 1.2-kilometer-long geographical route, as you admire species from the Black Sea to the Pacific Ocean.   Gaze at the 17 different ocean environments and rainforests, while keeping an eye out for sharks, balloon fish, piranhas, penguins, clownfish, and many other fascinating water animals. After exploring, head back to the shuttle bus to return to Sultanahmet.

  • Skip-the-line entry ticket to the Istanbul Aquarium
Excluded
  • Hotel pickup and drop-off

title: BAPS Hindu Mandir Abu Dhabi
description:
Explore the BAPS Hindu Mandir Abu Dhabi with our expert tour guides who provide consistent and accurate insights about this sacred site. title: Thames Cruise: Westminster to Tower Bridge (Butler's Wharf) with optional return
description:
Embark on an unforgettable journey through London's iconic landmarks with our Thames River sightseeing cruise. Setting sail from Westminster Pier and gliding towards Tower Bridge (Butler‚Äôs Wharf Pier), you'll be treated to panoramic views of St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral, The Shard, Tate Modern, and the legendary Globe Theatre. As you dock at Butler‚Äôs Wharf, soak in the blend of heritage and contemporary allure, where historic trading meets modern gastronomy and chic living. Experience the capital from a unique perspective that's sure to leave a lasting impression. Tour Description

See the best of London from the water on this Thames River sightseeing cruise, from Westminster Pier to Tower Bridge (Butler’s Wharf Pier).

Climb aboard our sightseeing tour at Westminster Pier and cruise through the heart of London, admiring famous landmarks such as St. Paul’s Cathedral, The Shard, the Tate Modern, and the world-famous Globe Theatre.

Butler’s Wharf offers a memorable stop with its mix of heritage and modern charm. Once a busy trading hub, it’s now home to trendy restaurants, bars, and stylish apartments.

Experience a unique perspective, grab a beverage and snack from our fully licenced bars, and sit back as our local skippers provide entertaining information about London’s history and its famous sights.


Westminister Pier

Westminster is the most popular starting point for people travelling on the Thames River Sightseeing boat service on the River Thames.

Located next to the Houses of Parliament, it’s within a short walking distance of major tourist attractions such as Westminster Abbey and the Cabinet War Rooms north of the river, the London Aquarium, the London Dungeon, and more.


Tower Bridge (Butler's Wharf Pier)

Butler’s Wharf offers a memorable stop with its mix of heritage and modern charm. Once a busy trading hub, it’s now home to trendy restaurants, bars, and stylish apartments.

Take a leisurely walk along the riverbank and enjoy stunning views of Tower Bridge and the city skyline. Don’t forget to visit the Tower Bridge Museum to learn about its fascinating history and across the bridge, you’ll find the famous Tower of London, home to the Crown Jewels.

Just a short walk along the southern bank of the river, you can also visit the Second World War warship HMS Belfast, which is now a museum about life onboard during a conflict.


Important Information
Q: Can traveller's disembark at Butler’s Wharf Pier and get a later boat back?
A: Yes. For a return cruise, a change of boat is required at Butler’s Wharf

Q: What's the total journey time from Westminister Pier to Tower Bridge?
A: The journey time from Westminster Pier out to Tower Bridge (Butler’s Wharf) is 30 minutes.

Q: Do you sell food or drinks on board?
A: Yes, we have fully licensed bars selling a wide range of tasty
snacks and drinks, both non-alcoholic and alcoholic.  

Q: What Attractions and Activities are there to enjoy at Butler's Wharf area?
A: The top attractions and activities around Butler’s Wharf include the Tower Bridge, Tower of London, HMS Belfast, St. Katharine’s Dock and Borough Market. You can find more details on our Attractions page.


How to get there

By public transportation: Easily reach the starting point by taking the Central, District, or Jubilee lines to Westminster Tube Station. Upon exiting the station, a leisurely 2-minute walk will lead you to the boat's embarkation point. Embark on an unforgettable journey through London's iconic landmarks with our Thames River sightseeing cruise.

Setting sail from Westminster Pier and gliding towards Tower Bridge (Butler’s Wharf Pier), you'll be treated to panoramic views of St. Paul’s Cathedral, The Shard, Tate Modern, and the legendary Globe Theatre.

As you dock at Butler’s Wharf, soak in the blend of heritage and contemporary allure, where historic trading meets modern gastronomy and chic living.

Experience the capital from a unique perspective that's sure to leave a lasting impression.

title: Doha Sports Tour
description:
Qatar has grown into a hub of sports in the world with its finest sporting facilities and role in international sporting events. This tour will take you among iconic venues that staged the FIFA World Cup as you learn its history and significance in truly changing the sports landscape of the country. Tour Highlights
  • Check out the Khalifa International Stadium and nearby 3-2-1 Qatar Olympic and Sports Museum
  • Qatar Foundation Stadium located in the heart of Education City surrounded by leading universities, where cutting-edge research is conducted and academics
  • Drive by Lusail City & see the Lusail Stadium where the final match of the FIFA World Cup 2022 was hosted
  • Drive by Corniche, a 7km long waterfront promenade
  • Visit Box Park and the new Mina District inside Doha Port
  • Explore the alleyways of Souq Waqif, the country’s traditional heritage market located in the heart of the city

Inclusions
  • Pick up and drop off from your location within Doha city limits
  • Transportation in an air-conditioned vehicle with an English-speaking driver
  • Entry fee to 3-2-1 Qatar Olympic and Sports Museum
  • Visit local famous sporting locations such as Khalifa International Stadium, Qatar Foundation Stadium and Lusail Stadium
  • Enjoy shopping local handicrafts and souvenirs from Souq Waqif and taking beautiful photos from the Mina District
  • Bottled water on board

Exclusions
  • Snacks or meals

Important Note
  • Admission to the stadiums is not permitted and the tour takes you to a drive by the stadium from outside.
  • Bring snacks, sunblock and wear comfortable modest clothing especially during summer months. 
  • Tour is non-guided.
  • Booking should be made 24 hours in advance with payment.
  • Below 3 years – Infant free of charge

 Qatar has become a global sports hub with its top-tier sporting facilities and role in international events. This tour will take you through iconic venues from the FIFA World Cup, highlighting their history and impact on Qatar's sports landscape. You'll visit the legendary Khalifa International Stadium and the nearby 3-2-1 Qatar Olympic and Sports Museum, an interactive sports museum in Doha showcasing the nation's rich sports heritage. Explore the Qatar Foundation Stadium in Education City, surrounded by leading universities and cutting-edge research. Drive through Lusail City to see Lusail Stadium, which hosted the final match of the FIFA World Cup 2022.

Additionally, you'll drive by the Corniche, a 7km waterfront promenade, visit Box Park and the new Mina District in Doha Port, and explore the traditional alleyways of Souq Waqif, the heart of the city. This tour offers a comprehensive view of Qatar's dedication to sports, culture, and heritage.

title: Hop-on Hop-off London Bus Tour & St Paul's Cathedral and free walking tour
description:
Explore the most iconic and historical places in London through a Hop-on Hop-off bus tour. Begin your journey at St Paul's Cathedral, a magnificent landmark with a rich history. Continue the tour to discover renowned attractions such as the Tower of London and Westminster Abbey, while also experiencing famous streets like Regent Street and Oxford Street. This tour offers a comprehensive and flexible way to immerse yourself in the grandeur of London's top destinations. Highlights


Hop-on Hop-off Tour of London  

Explore imperious London in all its grandeur. This incredible value London Hop on Hop off bus tour grants you the freedom and convenience to explore the city in depth. This tour encompasses world renowned attractions such as the Tower of London, Shakespeare’s Globe and spectacular Westminster Abbey, as well as, of course, the inimitable Buckingham Palace. You will also see the most eminent regions of London, such as distinguished Regent Street, world celebrated Oxford Street and vibrant Piccadilly.  


The Routes   You can use any of the routes available:  
  • The Classic Tour (Blue route): Covers all the main Central London sights and visits London’s Museum Quarter.
  • The Essential Tour (Red route): Passes Madame Tussauds and Kings Cross, as well as Hyde Park and Regents Park, two of the prettiest parks in London.
  • The Museum Tour (Orange route): Explore London's world-famous museums with the Museum Tour and along the way pass by the beautiful Royal Albert Hall, Harrods and Buckingham Palace.
  • The Morning and Evening Drop off Service (Yellow and Green routes): Operating in the morning and late afternoon, this route travels from the popular hotel districts to Central London.



St Paul's Cathedral  

Enjoy entrance to the Cathedral dedicated to St Paul that has overlooked the City of London since 604 AD. The current Cathedral - the fourth to occupy this site - was designed by the court architect Sir Christopher Wren after its predecessor was destroyed in the Great Fire of London. Dominating the London skyline, the magnificent domed cathedral was completed in 1710. Visitors can explore the interior and enjoy a new multimedia guide which weaves together contemporary photography, archive film footage (including the wedding of HRH Prince Charles & Lady Diana Spencer) and the voices of those who work in St Paul’s today.

*Choose the duration of your tour, from 1 day, 24 or 48 hours, pick a ticket duration that suits you.




River Thames Boat Ride
  • Boat Ride available with the 24hrs or 48hrs Hop on Hop off bus tour.
Enjoy an enthralling sightseeing cruise along the heart of London’s River Thames with this City Cruises boat ride. Departing from Westminster taking you to Tower Millennium Pier, or vice versa, you’ll get to soak in panoramic views of the capital’s most iconic landmarks for a sightseeing experience like no other! Discover fascinating facts as you cruise with live commentary from the captain or audio guide.




Free Walking Tours   Enjoy the Jack The Ripper Walking Tour and/or the Royal Walking Tour as part of your sightseeing day out in London. Learn about King Charles’ Coronation and coronations of the past as well as interesting facts about members of the royal family. On your 2-hour tour, you’ll also visit fantastic royal sites and watch the Changing of the Guard ceremony. Or why not play detective by travelling back to Victorian London to investigate the morbid murders carried out by infamous Jack the Ripper. See where vital clues were found and learn more about his victims and possible suspects.

  • Jack the Ripper Walking Tour
       Start time: 3:30pm daily (Please arrive 15 minutes prior to departure time) Finish time: 5pm                     Departure Point and Directions: Exit Tower Hill Station, London and wait at the Ice Cream                         Refreshments stand next to the station exit Return Location: Near Liverpool Street Underground               Station
  • Royal London Walking Tour
      Start time: 10am daily (Please arrive 15 minutes prior to departure time) Finish: 12pm Departure              Point: Tourist Bus Stop outside The King's Gallery, Buckingham Palace, Buckingham Gate, SW1A 1AA         (Nearest underground station: Victoria and Green Park) Return Point: Westminster Abbey (Nearest             underground station: Westminster Station)


Inclusions
  •  1 day, 24 hours or 48 hours Hop-on Hop-off Ticket
  •  Audio guides available in 11 languages (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Chinese,   Russian, Brazilian Portuguese, Hindi, Japanese and Arabic).
  •  River Thames boat ride valid for one-way (valid with 24hr and 48hr bus ticket only) *Operated   by  City Cruises*
  •  Admission to St Paul's Cathedral

Exclusions:
  •  Food and Baverages


Important Note

River Thames Boat Ride:
  • One way ticket with 24hrs and 48hrs bus ticket. (Operated by City Cruises)
  • Boats leave every 30 minutes from: Westminster Pier to Tower Millennium Pier or vice versa
  • Your ticket will be valid for one way journey only and not for a return trip.
  • Your one way boat ride ticket is valid from: Westminster Pier to Tower Millennium Pier or vice versa.
  • Open All Year except 24, 25, 26 December and 1st January.
St Paul's Cathedral:
  • Open Monday to Saturday only
  • Special services and events may mean that all or part of the Cathedral are closed either in advance or short notice
Hop on Hop off London Bus Tours:
  • This is Hop-On Hop-Off bus service, you can join at any Golden Tours bus stop.
  • No restroom available on board.
  • We will no longer be providing complimentary face masks to all our guests, but you are very welcome to wear your own mask.
  • Buses will be cleaned thoroughly after every tour.
**Tickets may be cancelled up to midnight the day before travel to receive a full refund.



Where We Meet

title: Topkapi Palace: Guided Tour
description:
It is the biggest museum in Istanbul. The location of the palace is just behind the Hagia Sophia in the historical city center of Istanbul. The original use of the palace was the house for the Sultan; today, the palace is functioning as a museum. Important highlights in this palace are; the harem, treasury, kitchens, and many more.
  • Embark on a whirlwind one and half hour journey through the living history of Topkapi Palace, where your guide weaves tales of its Ottoman legacy and reveals the secrets held within its walls.
  • Marvel at the architectural grandeur of Topkapi Palace, tucked just behind the Hagia Sophia in Istanbul's historic core, once the Sultan's residence and now a vibrant museum.
  • Explore the palace's hidden gems and unveil the essence of a bygone era as you delve into the vibrant museum experience.
  • Discover the treasures within Topkapi Palace, as your guide offers a glimpse into the palace's rich history and cultural significance, showcasing its Ottoman legacy.

title: Basilica Cistern Entry Ticket with¬†Guided¬†Tour
description:
On this 30-minute tour, visit the 4th-century Basilica Cistern and discover the mystery of Medusa heads from Greek mythology. Visit the Basilica Cistern, built in the 4th century and enlarged in 532 AD, used as water storage during Byzantine times. Listen to your guide as they explain the mystery of Medusa heads from Greek mythology.   Explore this cathedral-size cistern, built during the reign of Emperor Justinian I in 532 A.D. to supply water to the Great Palace. It stores up to 80,000 cubic meters of water, delivered via 20 kilometers of aqueducts from a reservoir near the Black Sea.   Descend the fifty-two stone steps into the entrance of the cistern. The cistern is surrounded by a firebrick wall with a thickness of 4 meters, coated with a waterproofing mortar. Hear how the Basilica Cistern's water comes from the Eƒürikapƒ± Water Distribution Center in the Belgrade Forest and travels through the 971-meter-long Valens Aqueduct and the 115-meter-long Maƒülova Aqueduct, built by the Emperor Justinian.

Important things to know before you visit
  • Entrance to Basilica Cistern can only be done with our guide.
  • Basilica Cistern tour is in the English language.
  • We recommend being at the meeting point 5 minutes before the start to avoid any problems.
Meeting Point

Meet with the guide in front of the Busforus Bus Stop at Sultanahmet Square. Our guide will hold the Istanbul E-pass flag at the meeting point and time. Busforus Old City Stop is located across the Hagia Sophia, and you can easily see red double-decker buses.

Free Cancelation

Cancel up to 24 hours in advance for a full refund

Descend fifty-two stone steps into the intriguing depths of the Basilica Cistern Museum, an architectural marvel dating back to the 4th century, with significant expansions in 532 AD in this Basicila Cistern Guided Tour.

Initially serving as a vital water storage facility during Byzantine times, this cathedral-sized cistern, commissioned by Emperor Justinian I, continues to mesmerize visitors with its historical significance and engineering ingenuity. As you explore, your guide will unravel the enigmatic tale behind the Medusa heads adorning the columns.

Immerse yourself in the vastness of this underground reservoir, capable of holding up to 80,000 cubic meters of water. Constructed with meticulous precision, its firebrick walls, four meters thick and waterproofed with mortar, stand as a testament to ancient craftsmanship.

Learn about its impressive water supply system, spanning 20 kilometers of aqueducts from a reservoir near the Black Sea, including the renowned Valens and Maƒülova Aqueducts, masterpieces of engineering from the era of Emperor Justinian. Experience the timeless allure of the Basilica Cistern beneath the bustling streets of Istanbul.

title: Istanbul: Small-Group Sunset or Day Yacht Cruise with Snacks
description:

From the deck of our snow-white yacht, you will have the opportunity to behold nearly all of Istanbul's major landmarks: Dolmabahce Palace, Topkapi and Chiragan Palaces, Sultan Suleiman Mosque, the city's main bridge—the Bosphorus Bridge—and, of course, the famous Maiden Tower.

title: Daily Pierre Loti Hill and Miniaturk Tour: Half-Day Trip in Istanbul
description:
Pierre Loti is one of the best places to visit in Istanbul.
  • Amazing view of Golden Horn from the sky!
  • Pierre Loti is one of the best places to visit in ƒ∞stanbul!
  • You can learn the history of this beautiful and pastoral place amid a buzzing city!

Discover one of Istanbul's most fascinating tourist destinations!
Pierre Loti is one of the best places to visit in Istanbul. Julien Viaud, a French writer, is honoured with the hill's name. After moving to Istanbul, the author began writing his novels in a coffee shop. He later changed his name, and this hill carries his name.  

With its charming and one-of-a-kind ambience, this location will enchant you. Pierre Loti Hill Istnbul is a fascinating tourist attraction in Istanbul. It's also one of the greatest spots to go if you want to get a good view of the Golden Horn and historical buildings from a high vantage point above the city. Additionally, there are many restaurants which serve delicious dishes. After your meal, you can smoke your hookah while enjoying the amazing view. All of this is within reach with the Istanbul Tourist Pass including Pierre Loti Turkey!

Included

  • Drop off at Miniaturk Museum
  • Cable Car Ride
  • Eyüp Sultan Mosque
  • Miniaturk Enteranca
  • Visit to Pierre Loti Hill

Excluded
  • Meals and drinks
  • Personal expenses
  • Hotel Pick Up

Important things to know before you visit
  • This is a Half-Day tour combined with Miniaturk And Eyup Sultan Mosque.
  • Since there are other passengers in the group Pick-Up proccess could be take 1 hour or more depending on hotels location.
  • This tour needs reservation in advance.
  • Visiting the mosque during the tour will be around 60 minutes.
  • Drop off is in Miniaturk Museum, not in your hotel.
  • Drinks and Meals are not included
  • Personal expenses are not included
  • This tour is not wheelchair accessible
Free Cancelation

Cancel up to 24 hours in advance for a full refund
 Pierre Loti Hill in Istanbul is a must-visit destination that beautifully combines history, culture, and scenic beauty. Named after Julien Viaud, a French writer who adopted the pseudonym Pierre Loti, the hill celebrates his connection to the city. Loti began crafting his renowned novels in a quaint coffee shop here, and today, the hill honours his legacy with its name.

Visitors are captivated by the hill's unique and enchanting atmosphere. A cable car ride to the summit offers breathtaking views of the Golden Horn and the historic skyline of Istanbul. Once at the top, numerous restaurants await, serving delicious dishes that reflect the rich culinary heritage of the city. After a satisfying meal, you can relax with a hookah, taking in the mesmerizing panorama.

This tour also includes a visit to the historic Eyüp Sultan Mosque, a significant religious site in Istanbul, and a visit to Miniaturk Istanbul, an exceptional open-air museum that showcases miniature models of Turkey's most iconic landmarks. Spanning over 60,000 square meters, Miniaturk Museum features meticulously crafted replicas of historic sites, architectural marvels, and cultural monuments from across the country. It's a unique opportunity to explore Turkey's rich heritage in a compact form, making it perfect for all ages.

With the Istanbul Tourist Pass, you can easily experience Pierre Loti Hill, Eyup Sultan Mosque and Miniaturk, making for a memorable half-day tour that highlights the best of Istanbul's charm and history.

title: Jet Ski Tour Dubai
description:

Speed across the water to admire and take photos of the sail-shaped Burj and then bounce across the waves back to base.

Depart from our Marina with an instructor, leading the way to the famous 7- star Hotel, the Burj Al Arab. This hotel has been built on the sea, so no better way to admire it from your jet ski. Photo opportunities at the symbolic building of the city. Then we head back to our marina at a speed!

title: Beatles Liverpool Walking Tour
description:
Take to the streets of the vibrant city of Liverpool for a fabulous 2.15 hours walking tour exploring the special places connected to The Beatles. After meeting your local Beatles Guide, you‚Äôll discover many attractions and learn more about the band‚Äôs path to global fame in the 1960s. Promenade along the historical and stunning Liverpool Waterfront, where you‚Äôll see the Royal Albert Dock ‚Äî a restored former working dock, The Pier Head and more. But most exciting of all is the iconic statue of the Fab Four. These larger-than-life figures were donated by the Cavern Club in 2015 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the band‚Äôs last performance in Liverpool. The tour will then continue onto Mathew Street where the legendary Cavern Club is located. It‚Äôs here that the Beatles played 292 times in the 1960s. You‚Äôll also spot statues of John Lennon and Cilla Black as well as the Cavern Wall of Fame and the 4 Lads Who Shook The World sculpture. As you stroll around, take a selfie with the Eleanor Rigby statue ‚Äî one of the Beatles‚Äô most iconic songs and the Brian Epstein statue, the manager of The Beatles. See the famous Liverpool Town Hall, where hundreds of thousands of people gathered in 1964 to greet the band after their conquering of the US. You may also be able to go inside and see their names in the Entrance Hall inscribed on the list of Honorary Freeman. What‚Äôs more, pop into the Hard Days Night Hotel or the Central Library, which holds archives telling the story how everything began for The Beatles.
Timing:

  • Morning: 10:30 AM
  • Afternoon: 02:00 PM

Highlights:

  • Discover statues of the Fab Four in their hometown
  • Explore the city with a fun and knowledgeable local guide
  • See iconic Beatles attractions including the Cavern Club
  • A must for any Beatles fan


Inclusions & Exclusions

Inclusions:

  • 2.15 hours walking tour in Liverpool
  • Fun and knowledgeable local guide

Exclusions:

  • Food and drink
  • Entry fees

Important Information:
  • This tour is only available in English.
  • Under 18s must be accompanied by an adult (18+).
  • This tour is not suitable for wheelchair users due to uneven surfaces on the route.
  • Guests must arrive 15 minutes prior to the start of the tour to check-in.
  • This tour does not go inside the Cavern Club.
Please meet us at:

School Lane, Liverpool, L1 3BX Take to the streets of the vibrant city of Liverpool for a fabulous 2.15 hours walking tour exploring the special places connected to The Beatles. After meeting your local Beatles Guide, you’ll discover many attractions and learn more about the band’s path to global fame in the 1960s.

Promenade along the historical and stunning Liverpool Waterfront, where you’ll see the Royal Albert Dock — a restored former working dock, The Pier Head and more. But most exciting of all is the iconic statue of the Fab Four. These larger-than-life figures were donated by the Cavern Club in 2015 to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the band’s last performance in Liverpool.

The tour will then continue onto Mathew Street where the legendary Cavern Club is located. It’s here that the Beatles played 292 times in the 1960s. You’ll also spot statues of John Lennon and Cilla Black as well as the Cavern Wall of Fame and the 4 Lads Who Shook The World sculpture. As you stroll around, take a selfie with the Eleanor Rigby statue — one of the Beatles’ most iconic songs and the Brian Epstein statue, the manager of The Beatles.

See the famous Liverpool Town Hall, where hundreds of thousands of people gathered in 1964 to greet the band after their conquering of the US. You may also be able to go inside and see their names in the Entrance Hall inscribed on the list of Honorary Freeman.

What’s more, pop into the Hard Days Night Hotel or the Central Library, which holds archives telling the story how everything began for The Beatles.

title: York City Sightseeing Cruise
description:
The York City Cruise provides an entertaining and informative tour of the historic city as seen from the River Ouse. Enjoy the sights from a different perspective as a friendly and knowledgeable team guides you leisurely up and downstream. Tour Highlights



Boats depart from both the King’s Staith landing and the Lendal Bridge landing. Admire the scenery from the comfort of the enclosed saloon or the upper deck and treat yourself to a refreshing drink from the bar.  

The duration of the cruise is either 45 minutes or 1 hour and is determined by the weather on the day and by demand. Your ticket will be valid for whatever duration is offered on the day of your visit.  


Typically the 1-hour cruise follows a route that heads upstream to Clifton Bridge on the northern outskirts of York city and then downstream as far as the Millennium Bridge on the city’s southern outskirts, before returning back upstream to the original landing stage. The 45-minute cruise operates in the same area without going quite as far in either direction, passing through the center of the walled city.  

During the cruise, the captain will keep you entertained with live commentary about the sites you pass. Learn about York’s history of flooding and its prosperity as an inland port, as you sail along the river that brought the Romans and the Vikings to this site.  

You’ll sail on a vessel that features an enclosed and heated saloon, rest rooms and a fully stocked bar serving beers, wines, spirits, soft drinks, hot drinks and snacks.


Timings
  Start time: King's Staith at 10:30am, 12:00pm, 1:30pm, 3:00pm & 4:00pm  

Inclusions

  •  River cruise
  •  Live commentary
  •  Access to on-board facilities (enclosed and heated saloon,rest rooms and a fully stocked bar serving beers, wines, spirits, soft drinks, hot drinks and snacks.)


Exclusions
  • Gratuities
  Important Note

  • Additional sailings can operate every 30 minutes between these times, you will be advised of this whilst waiting.
  • The usual route turns at Clifton Bridge and Millennium Bridge, but can vary.

Where We Meet: 

King's Staith landing, King's Staith, York, YO1 9SN Experience the beauty and history of York from a unique vantage point with the York City Sightseeing Cruise, an entertaining and informative tour along the picturesque River Ouse. Departing from both the King’s Staith landing and the Lendal Bridge landing, this leisurely cruise offers you the chance to admire the city’s landmarks from a new perspective.  

The duration of the York river cruise is either 45 minutes or 1 hour, depending on the weather and demand on the day of your visit. Your ticket will be valid for the duration offered, ensuring a flexible and enjoyable experience. The 1-hour cruise typically travels upstream to Clifton Bridge on York’s northern outskirts and downstream to the Millennium Bridge on the southern outskirts, providing a comprehensive tour of the city’s scenic riverside. The 45-minute cruise covers a similar route but remains within the city’s walled center.  

Relax in the comfort of the enclosed, heated saloon or enjoy the fresh air on the upper deck. As you sail, the captain’s live commentary will enrich your journey with fascinating insights into York’s rich history, including its frequent flooding and its significance as an inland port. Learn how the River Ouse played a crucial role in bringing Romans and Vikings to this historic city.  

Your cruise vessel is equipped with modern amenities, including restrooms and a fully stocked bar offering a selection of beers, wines, spirits, soft drinks, hot beverages, and snacks. Whether you choose a refreshing drink from the bar or simply sit back and enjoy the view, the York Boat Cruise promises a memorable and relaxing experience. Don’t miss this opportunity to explore York’s heritage from the water on this delightful river tour.

title: Beatles Explorer bus tour
description:

We then move across the city towards the areas in which the Fab Four and many others grew up. We take the time to stop at the Penny Lane Road sign and see the area made famous by the song.
