title: 99 Minutes Premium Boat Tour + FREE Garden Glow - Combo
description:
Unleash the magic of Dubai with our exclusive combo package! Sail through Dubai's wonders on a Yellow Boat Premium Tour, then let Dubai Garden Glow enchant your senses. Book now for a day of adventure and wonder like never before What To Expect:

Discover Dubai with our recommended Original Tour. This spectacular tour begins with a cruise around the stunning vista of Dubai Marina and then heads into the open water where you will see the amazing JBR, Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah, Atlantis the Palm, and Burj Al Arab. Our tour then returns to the coast with a first-class view of the Royal Palaces, Palm Lagoon, and Marina. On this trip, there is plenty to see, so get your cameras ready!

Experience the enchantment of Garden Glow in Dubai, featuring over 500 nature and art-inspired illusions that come to life in the glow of energy-saving bulbs and recycled materials.


Highlights:

  • Discover the parks’ five unique themed sections: Glow Park, Dinosaur Park, Ice Park, Dubai Garden Glow Magic Park.
  • Find other art and light across the park while strolling through the scenic routes at Dubai's glowing park.
  • Walk through glowing tunnels and take a glance at the most remarkable creations such as Talking Tree, Happy Forest, Happiness Street, and My Dubai.
  • Enjoy daily acrobatic performances that will leave both adults and young ones in awe.
  • Depart from Dubai Marina, and sail into open waters.
  • Explore Ain Dubai, Palm Jumeirah, Atlantis, and Burj Al Arab.
  • The premuim 99-minute boat tour reveals exclusive views in Dubai, expert insights, and comfort on inflatable ribs.

Kids Go Free offer by Yellow Boats  
  • Kids below 12 years are eligible for 1 complimentary ticket per paying adult with the following conditions.
  • Children under 5 are not allowed. Children over 5 must be accompanied by an adult.
  • Booking period & Offer validity: 01st June to 30th Sept 2024.
  • During the campaign, free entry is offered to kids below 12 years when accompanied by a paying adult and normal charges will apply if there are additional kids.(e.g. For 2 paying adults and 3 children, 2 children will go free, and the 3rd child will pay for a ticket).
  • The team at Yellow Boats will allow kids below 12 years to enter for free when the accompanying adult presents a ticket at the ticketing counter.


Inclusions:
  • 99 Mins Premium Yellow Boat Sightseeing tour
  • life jacket
  • Bottled water
  • Admission to Dubai Garden Glow, Dinosaur Park & Art Park.
 
Exclusions:
  • Hotel Pick-up and Drop-off
  • Meals
  • Entry to Magic Park

Timing's:

Yellow Boat 99 Mins Premium Tour:
  • Daily at 09:00, 10:00, 11:00, 16:00, 17:00 and 18:00

Dubai Garden Glow:
  • Sunday to Friday 05:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.
  • Saturdays and National Holidays: 05:00 p.m. to 12:00 a.m.

 

Ticket Information:
  • Yellow Boat tickets are dated tickets and need to be redeemed on the booked date and time slot.
  • Dubai Garden Glow Tickets are valid for 30 days from the purchase date.
  • Yellow Boat & Dubai Garden Glow ticket sales are final and are 100% non-refundable.
  • Meeting Point: Yellow Boat-Dubai Marina Walk (Find our kiosk opposite Spinneys supermarket and The Coffee Club - Marina G)

Important thing to know before you visit:

Garden Glow
  • Dubai Garden Glow Dress Code: Casual, appropriate clothing is allowed inside the park.
  • Dubai Garden Glow Age & Health Restrictions: A visit to Dubai Garden Glow is suitable for people of all ages, including expecting mothers.

Premium Tour
  • All guests must carry a valid passport or Emirates ID.
  • Passengers should arrive at least 30 minutes before departure.
  • Missing the scheduled departure results in no later booking or refund.
  • Children under 5 are not allowed. Children over 5 must be accompanied by an adult.
  • The Yellow Boats may reschedule or refund tours with insufficient passengers.
  • The company reserves the right to cancel cruises for various reasons.
  • Pregnant ladies and guests with back or neck problems are not permitted.
  • Passengers must be physically fit and able to manage the tours.
  • Passengers should inform the company of any medical conditions or disabilities.
  • Please note that the reporting time: 30 minutes prior to the departure

How to get there:

Yellow Boat:

Via E12 Highway (Sheikh Khalifa Bin Zayed Highway) Take the Corniche Road towards Mina Zayed Port and follow signs for Yas Island. Take the E12 Sheikh Khalifa Highway. Follow the blue signs that say, 'Yas Leisure Drive' and follow the brown tourist signs that say, 'Ferrari World Abu Dhabi'. drive till you reach Yas Bay Parking lot


Dubai Garden Glow:

By car: Dubai Garden Glow is centrally located in Zabeel park, which is easily accessible by car. You can park the car in the nearby public parking for a small fee.    

By public transportation: The park is easily accessible by public transportation. You can take the metro to the Al Jafiliya station, then take a short cab ride to the park.    

By taxi: You can also take a taxi to the park from anywhere in Dubai. It’s a popular destination, and most taxi drivers will be familiar with the location. title: The View at The Palm - Fast Track + Next Level - Non-prime Hours
description: The star attraction of Nakheel Mall will offer 360-degree spectacular, uninterrupted views of The Palm, the Arabian Gulf, the Dubai skyline, and will reveal the incredible story behind the making of the man-made island that put Dubai on the global map.	Visitors to The View will start their journey at the roof plaza of Nakheel Mall, where they will find an interactive museum and gallery dedicated to the creation of Palm Jumeirah. From there, an elevator, complete with a floor-to-ceiling digital sea, sand and sky experience, will take them on the 45-second ascent to the observatory at the top of The Palm Tower, where they can marvel at the island beneath them, and enjoy breathtaking views from levels 52 and 54. Once visitors have come back down to earth, they can refuel at The View café or browse the gift shop at the Nakheel Mall Rooftop.	There are vistas. Then, there is The Next Level Experience. Take wonder to whole new level. Discover the Next Level & enjoy fast-track access to the highest deck at 250m above sea level. Immerse yourself in breathtaking views of Palm Jumeirah, the Arabian Gulf, and the stunning city skyline. Elevate your visit today!

title: Jubail Mangrove Park - Boardwalk Experience
description:
Jubail Mangrove Park is an amazing destination for nature lovers, photographers, and anyone looking for a peaceful retreat in Abu Dhabi. The 2-kilometer boardwalk offers three trails for exploration, showcasing the unique adaptations of mangroves and diverse marine life in tidal pools. Educational opportunities about nature and mangrove plants are also available, along with rest stops to relax and enjoy the surroundings. It's a true gem in Abu Dhabi's attractions and a must-visit for those seeking the beauty and serenity of UAE's natural wonders. Jubail Mangrove Park is a truly captivating destination that offers something for everyone. Whether you're a nature lover, a photographer, or simply seeking a peaceful getaway, the park is the perfect place to explore the tidal wonders of Abu Dhabi. The boardwalk is the main attraction, stretching for 2 kilometers and offering three different trails to explore. As you take a stroll, be sure to observe the unique adaptations of the mangroves and the diverse marine life that thrives in the tidal pools. Apart from the natural wonders, the park also offers educational opportunities about nature and mangrove plants. You'll also find rest stops along the way to take a break and enjoy the tranquility of the surroundings. Jubail Mangrove Park is a true gem in Abu Dhabi's collection of attractions and a must-visit destination for anyone who wants to experience the beauty and serenity of the UAE's natural wonders.

Located between two astonishing islands, the Yas Island and Saadiyat Island, lies the Jubail Island Mangrove Park. The Jubail Mangrove Park, Abu Dhabi, is a truly captivating destination offering something for everyone. Whether you’re into nature, photography, or simply looking for calm away from city life, you’ll find just what you need. 


One of the main highlights is what’s known as the Jubail Mangrove Park Boardwalk, Abu Dhabi. This consists of three different trails with a total size of two kilometers, which is why it can also be referred to as “the Jubail Mangrove Walking Park.”


Jubail Mangrove National Park in Abu Dhabi’s trails allow you to observe the park's natural wonders, including the unique mangrove plants and diverse marine life, and the chance to learn more about nature. It's a must-see for anyone looking to experience Abu Dhabi’s natural beauty. You can see more information about tickets, entrance fees, and prices on this page. So, what are you waiting for? Get a chance to venture into this little piece of paradise.

title: Fujairah Adventure Park
description:
Welcome to the Fujairah Adventures Park, the number one urban adventure park in Fujairah. With Expertly-designed bike and hiking trails spread out over 20 hectares in the heart of Fujairah, the Bike Park offers the largest terrain of any urban bike park in UAE.


Highlights:
  • Pump Track: Middle East's first pedaling-free ride, suitable for all skill levels.
  • Quick Flight: Thrilling 12-meter leap from a tower with a secure harness.
  • Wall Climbing: Vertical excitement and accomplishment at Fujairah Adventure Park.
  • Kayak (Double & Single): Tranquil water adventure in Fujairah's adventure haven.
  • Archery: Focus, skill, and joy combined in this mark-hitting experience.
  • Axe-Throwing: Precision and adventure in a safe environment.
  • Bag Jump: Gravity-defying thrill for daredevils from 10 years and up.
  • Dirt Jump: Adrenaline-charged track for Advanced and Expert riders at Fujairah Adventure Park.


Inclusions:
  • Entry to Fujairah Adventure Park

Exclusions:
  • Pick-up & drop-off
  • Food & drinks


Timing:
  • Monday to Friday: 04:00 p.m. to 11:00 p.m.
  • Saturday to Sunday: 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 a.m. & 04:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m.


Key Facilities:
Rental Zone, Bike Service, Coffee Shop, Hiking Trails, Shuttle Service, Rest rooms with showers, Cinema Area, Resting Area, Medical Room, Parking Area & Private Chalets



Important things to know before your visit:
  • Park Guidelines: Please keep in mind that Fujairah Adventure Park is a nature-based facility where guests are expected to maintain a quiet environment after 11pm. Alcohol is not permitted on the premises.
  • Activity Hours: Outdoor activities such as axe throwing, archery, air rifle, and wall climbing are available until 9 pm on weekends, and 6 pm on weekdays.
  • Attire and Recommendations: Wearing closed shoes for all activities is mandatory. It's recommended to wear sunscreen, a cap, and stay hydrated during your visit.
  • Additional Services: Early bird requests, F&B services, special F&B requests for groups, transportation services, team building packages, chalet packages, camping packages, and guided tours are available on request.
  • Voluntary Participation: Acknowledge voluntary participation in specified activities at Fujairah Adventure Park.
  • Risk Acceptance: Assume all associated risks, including negligence or equipment defects.
  • Health and Compliance: Ensure good physical and mental health, comply with safety regulations, and refrain from substance use.
  • Liability Waiver: Release Provider and Operator from liability for any damages or injuries.

title: Istanbul Sapphire Observation Deck
description:
Istanbul Sapphire Observation Deck Istanbul Sapphire is one of the tallest buildings in Europe and Turkey. The building is 260 meters in height. At the height of 231 meters, it has one of the highest observation decks in Istanbul. Observation Deck is located at the top of Sapphire Shopping Mall, where you can find famous brands and restaurants. We are sure that you have never looked at Istanbul from this point of view. From here, you can see Princes' islands, the Bosphorus, Asian and European sides of the city, bridges, even the Hagia Sophia Mosque.The elevator to reach Istanbul Sapphire Observatory travels at an average speed of 20 kilometers per hour. When you get to the Terrace, Istanbul will be "under" your feet. You'll see buildings like matchboxes, people like ants. There are information boards to show the distances to popular cities from around the world. You can witness the view from behind the glass.In 2020, Camlica Tower was built to function as Observation Deck. The tower is over 365 meters, but the observatory deck terrace is at 220 meters. It is located on the Asian Side of Istanbul. Sapphire Observation Deck is located at the European side of Istanbul and still the highest observatory of Istanbul for view terrace.

Observation Deck is located at the top of Sapphire Shopping Mall, where you can find famous brands and restaurants.

We are sure that you have never looked at Istanbul from this point of view. From here, you can see the Princes' islands, the Bosphorus, Asian and European sides of the city, bridges, and even the Hagia Sophia Mosque.

The elevator to reach Istanbul Sapphire Observatory travels at an average speed of 20 kilometers per hour. When you get to the Terrace, Istanbul will be "under" your feet. There are information boards to show the distances to popular cities from around the world. You can witness the view from behind the glass.

In 2020, Camlica Tower was built to function as an Observation Deck. The tower is over 365 meters, but the observatory deck terrace is at 220 meters. It is located on the Asian Side of Istanbul. Sapphire Observation Deck is located at the European side of Istanbul and is still the highest observatory in Istanbul for a view terrace.

title: Al Shindagha Museum
description: Al Shindagha Museum is a world-class heritage museum that connects Emiratis, residents and visitors with the rich heritage of the emirate, and reveals the strong relationship between the past and the future.	Al Shindagha Museum tells the story of the rich cultural heritage of Dubai, the nation's proud past and Emirati traditions. A world-class heritage museum committed to education, exploration and celebration of culture. Set along the historical area of Al Shindagha neighbourhood, it has witnessed the dramatic development of the emirate. Today, the carefully curated 21 houses within the district feature interactive technology installations with a regular offering of public and educational programming for families, students and private groups. It reveals the cross-cultural aspects of the UAE providing guests with a tangible and intangible understanding of the museum. Among these Houses is The Al Maktoum Residence, one of the most prominent heritage sites that explores the erstwhile royal residence of His Highness Sheikh Al Maktoum, former Ruler of Dubai. The warm Emirati hospitality reflects in its museum's team of local and multi-lingual cultural guides which is welcoming to the community and the youth. The creek's remarkable transformation turns Al Shindagha Museum into the regional culture and traditional centre making it Dubai's largest heritage museum.	Learn about the rich cultural and heritage of Dubai with interactive installations and exhibits at one of the most prestigious museums in Dubai, Al Shindagha Museum.

title: Yas Marina Circuit Passenger Ride - Alfa Romeo Guilia Quadrifoglio

title: Luxury Sahara Desert Fortress Dinner without Dune Bashing
description:
. Discover the unique beauty of the desert as night falls. This special experience includes pick-up from your Dubai hotel, followed by a scenic journey on to our beautiful Sahara Desert Fortress. title: Ski Dubai: Snow Plus pass
description: Enjoy a full day of fun in the snow in the middle of the desert! Build a snowman, experience the rides, test out snowboarding and check the Avalanche Cafe.	Experience a winter wonderland at Ski Dubai, the first indoor ski resort in the region. Take a ride on the chairlift and be amazed by the breath-taking views of this iconic landmark. Get your adrenaline pumping by trying out the Zorb Ball, where you ride down the slope in a giant bubble-like ball, or strap yourself in for an exhilarating ride on the Mountain Thriller, a custom-built ride that rockets down a 185m high slope at speeds of up to 45kph - not for the faint-hearted. Glide through the snowy landscape and take in the incredible views on your tubing run. The Snow Plus package offers two exciting options to choose from: a 2-Hour Slope Pass exclusively designed for experienced skiers or snowboarders with a Skill Level of 2+ or 2 rides on the Snow Bullet zip line to add a thrilling dimension to your winter adventure. Along with your chosen activity, we provide a complete set of winter gear to ensure your comfort and safety. title: Blue Mosque & Hippodrome Guided Tour
description:
Located in the old city's heart, it is the most famous mosque in Istanbul and Turkey. Known by the name Blue Mosque, the original name of the Mosque is Sultanahmet Mosque. The tiles design the Blue Mosque interior which is named a Blue Mosque. These tiles come from the most famous tile-producing city in Turkey, Iznik. The tradition of naming mosques in the Ottoman Era is simple. The mosques are named after giving the mosque's order and spending money for the construction. For this reason, the majority of the mosques carry the name of those people. Another tradition is that the name of the region comes from the biggest mosque in that region. For this reason, there are three Sultanahmet. One is the mosque, one is the Sultan who gave the order for the mosque, and the third is the Sultanahmet area.
  • The Blue Mosque, also known as the Sultanahmet Mosque, is the most famous mosque in Istanbul and Turkey, located in the heart of the old city.
  • The mosque's interior is adorned with over 20,000 handmade Iznik ceramic tiles, which give the mosque its popular name "Blue Mosque."
  • The Sultanahmet Mosque is the only mosque in Istanbul that has six minarets, which was a display previously reserved only for the Prophet's mosque in Mecca, leading to some initial controversy.

Located in the old city's heart, it is the most famous mosque in Istanbul and Turkey. Known by the name Blue Mosque, the original name of the Mosque is Sultanahmet Mosque. The tradition of naming mosques in the Ottoman Era is simple. The mosques are named after giving the mosque's order and spending money for the construction. Important to know before your visit

Blue Mosque Tour is in the English language. The dress code is the same for all of the mosques in Tukey, ladies cover their hair and wear long skirts or loose trousers. Gentlemen can not wear shorts higher than knee lev
Meeting Point

Meet with the guide in front of the Busforus Sultanahmet (Old City) Stop. Our guide will hold the Istanbul E-pass flag at the meeting point and time. Busforus Old City Stop is located across the Hagia Sophia and you can easily see red double-decker buses.

How to get there

From the old city hotels; Take the T1 tram up to Sultanahmet tram station. The Mosque is within walking distance of the tram station.
From the Sultanahmet hotels; The Mosque is within walking distance to the majority of the hotels in the Sultanahmet area.
From the Taksim hotels; Take the funicular from Taksim Square to Kabatas. From Kabatas, take the T1 tram to Sultanahmet tram station. The Mosque is within walking distance of the tram station.

Free Cancelation

 

Cancel up to 24 hours in advance for a full refund

Located in the heart of Istanbul's old city, the Blue Mosque, also known as Sultanahmet Mosque, is one of the most famous mosques in Istanbul and Turkey. Its interior is adorned with stunning blue tiles, which give the mosque its nickname. These tiles originate from Iznik, Turkey's renowned tile-producing city.  

The tradition during the Ottoman Era was to name mosques after their patrons who financed the construction. As a result, many mosques, including the Blue Mosque, bear the names of their benefactors. Additionally, the area around the mosque is also named Sultanahmet, after both the mosque and the sultan who commissioned it.  

Visitors to the Blue Mosque can explore its intricate interior and admire the beautiful tile work. Admission is free, and guided tours are available to learn about the history and architecture of this iconic landmark. Additionally, don't miss a visit to the nearby Hippodrome of Istanbul, a historic site rich with ancient monuments.  

For the best experience, visitors should check the prayer times and plan their visit accordingly, avoiding prayer times if they are not joining the prayer.

title: 3d World Selfie Museum Dubai
description:
Welcome to the first 3D trick-art selfie museum in Dubai!

A museum with hand-painted 3D immersive artwork in nine different themed zones. Visitors pose with the paintings and become ‚Äúpart of the art", creating fun memories and unbeatable Instagram-worthy photos. Explore this colourful interactive gallery and have a blast!

3D World brings you closer to art through the use of ‚Äòtrick-art‚Äô paintings and optical illusions.

Channel your inner child and let the fun begin at 3D Selfie Museum Dubai!	3D World is a 23,000 sq. ft where you can indulge your creativity and imagination museum. There's a whole lot of art to indulge in but the process works best if you let your imagination run wild. That's how you achieve some magical photos! If you're really not into imagining stuff, don't worry! Our friendly staff will gladly help you come up with ideas that will create memories for you to take home. The term 'three-dimensional art' refers to a traditional art technique Trompe-l'oeil. Trompe-l'œil is French for "deceive the eye", something that misleads or deceives the senses, creating an illusion. This technique turns two-dimensional paintings into three-dimensional images through the use of optical illusions. Paintings on the walls, ceilings and ground bring you into the setting of the scene and suddenly you become part of the artwork. Illusions are images that are deceptive and misleading. Combining them with art creates an impression of a three-dimensional object on a flat surface. It allows visitors to interact with the art piece and save these memories on camera. Immerse yourself in our three-dimensional settings in the nine different zones at 3D World Dubai! Become a part of the art in our paintings and create memorable photos of your own with your creativity and imagination. At 3D World Dubai, we encourage visitors to interact and have fun with the art, taking as many photos as you want. These 3D paintings are not complete if you are not in them!	Explore 3D art pieces and optical illusions in this unique selfie museum with multiple exciting themes including animal kingdom, water world, fantasy, and humor at the 3D World Selfie Museum.

title: Muttrah Fort
description:
Built in the year 1507, as a defensive fort with the purpose of guarding the resources of Omani cities. The fort was later reinforced by the Portuguese to become a fort to protect and guard the city and its centre. Today you can enjoy, the historical architecture, the old cannons, Fort caf√© and the view of Muttrah corniche. Built-in 1507 as a defensive stronghold, Muttrah Fort in Oman was originally constructed to safeguard the vital resources of Omani cities. Later, the Portuguese reinforced its structure, transforming it into a strategic fortress to protect the city and its bustling center.

Today, visitors can immerse themselves in history by exploring the fort’s impressive architecture, admiring its ancient cannons, and taking in breathtaking panoramic views of Muttrah Corniche. After your journey through time, unwind at the Fort Café, where history and hospitality blend seamlessly.

title: Al Marmoom Domes Desert Glamping & Dining experience in Dubai
description:
. Al Marmoom Domes Desert Glamping is the UAE’s first eco-friendly glass dome resort and is considered a heritage village where luxury meets Emirati culture in the most amazing way. Picture waking up in your own private dome with a 360-degree view of the golden sands and lush greenery all around you. Each of the Al Marmoom luxury domes is designed to present the rich heritage of the UAE, creating a truly unique experience that you won’t find anywhere else.    

There’s no shortage of things to do at Al Marmoom! You can spend your nights stargazing with a high-powered telescope, go horseback riding at the famous Al Salah Horse Stud, or join cultural workshops to dive deep into Emirati traditions. If you love nature, the Al Marmoom Desert Conservation Reserve is the perfect place to explore. It’s the largest unfenced nature reserve in the UAE, and you can walk through the dunes or have a peaceful picnic surrounded by desert beauty.    

The food at Al Marmoom is another highlight, as it is awarded the Michelin Bib Gourmand Award. So get ready to enjoy high-quality authentic Emirati dishes along with international flavors, making every meal feel like a celebration. On top of that, each dome has its own private pool, so you can relax, soak up the sun during the day, or even stargaze at night under the clear desert sky. Join this experience now and check out our various tickets at different prices and offerings.

title: Hagia Sophia: Outer Visit Guided Tour
description:
Imagine a building standing in the same place for 1500 years, the number one temple for two religions. The headquarters of Orthodox Christendom and the first mosque in Istanbul. It was constructed within only 5 years. Its dome was the biggest dome with 55.60 in height and 31.87 diameters for 800 years in the world. Depictions of the religions side by side. Coronation place for the Roman Emperors. It was the meeting place of the Sultan and his people. That is the famous Hagia Sophia of Istanbul.
  • Learn all about Hagia Sophia before entry from professional local guides
  • Uncover lesser-known stories and secrets about majestic Hagia Sophia

How to get there

It is located in the heart of the old city. It is easy to access with the public transportation.

From the old city hotels; Get the T1 tram to Sultanahmet tram station. From there it takes 5 minutes of walk to arrive there.
From Taksim hotels; Get the funicular (F1 line) from the Taksim Square to Kabatas. From there, take the T1 tram to Sultanahmet tram station. It is 2-3 minutes walk from the tram station to reach there.
From Sultanahmet hotels; It is within walking distance from most hotels in the Sultanahmet area.

title: From Cairo Alexandria Catacombs, Citadel Day Trip with Lunch
description: .	Embark on a captivating full-day trip to the historic city of Alexandria, starting with a hotel pickup in Cairo or Giza and a scenic drive, including a brief stop for refreshments. Upon arrival, explore the ancient Roman amphitheater of Kom El-Deka, with its gardens, baths, and mosaics. Visit the Catacombs of Kom El Shoqafa, a unique blend of Egyptian, Greek, and Roman architecture, before heading to Pompey’s Pillar, an iconic Roman triumphal column. Enjoy a delicious lunch at a local restaurant, then stop for photos outside the Library of Alexandria, one of the ancient world’s largest archives. Finish with a visit to the Citadel of Qaitbay, built atop the Alexandria lighthouse ruins, before returning to your hotel in Cairo or Giza for a memorable day immersed in history.

title: Churchill War Rooms
description: Visit the iconic Churchill War Rooms, part of Imperial War Museums, which sheltered Sir Winston Churchill and his wartime government throughout the Second World War. Explore the underground bunker network that protected the staff and secrets at the heart of the British government as Churchill and his inner circle plotted the route to Allied victory.	The Cabinet War Rooms Construction on The Cabinet War Rooms, located beneath the Treasury building in the Whitehall area of Westminster, was completed on 27 August 1939, a week before Britain declared war on Germany. Get a glimpse of what life was like for those working in the bunker around the clock during Britain's darkest hour as the German Wehrmacht swept across Europe. In the Cabinet Room, you'll visit the nerve centre of the bunker complex and the place where the War Cabinet met. Those with a keen eye may be able to spot the scratch marks on Churchill's chair at the head of the table; a result of the Prime Minister's nervous clutching at the arms and wear caused by his signet ring. The Map Room Step back in time in the Map Room, which has been left as it was on the day the lights were switched off in 1945: On the walls, you'll notice hundreds of pin holes on the maps used to mark the progress of fleets across the ocean. Visitors will also get to see the top-secret Transatlantic Telephone Room used by Churchill to communicate with the President of the United States The Churchill Museum Discover Sir Winston Churchill's story in this fantastic exhibition dedicated to personal items and artefacts of the time, including his paintings, cigars and the door of No. 10 Downing Street. Learn about the remarkable story of Churchill's life, from his lonely childhood to his military career and two periods as Prime Minister. Explore Churchill's complex relationship with the Middle East This intimate display looks at the impact and influence of Winston Churchill on the modern Middle East, which is still subject to debate and controversy today. Part of the Churchill Museum, located at the Churchill War Rooms, the display uses photography, correspondence, an annotated map drawn up for Churchill in 1921 and audio-visual presentations to investigate Churchill's impact and influence on the Middle East. Opening Times Daily, 9:30am to 6:00pm, last entry 5:00pm Closed 24, 25 and 26 December Images: Churchill War Rooms © IWM	Housing the underground nerve centre where the British government directed the Second World War and the award-winning Churchill Museum, Churchill War Rooms is one of London’s must-see attractions

title: Skip-The-Line: Best of Ephesus Tour with Lunch
description:
Explore the historic and archaeological marvels of Ephesus, including the final house of Mary, the well-preserved ancient city with its monumental library and theater, the luxurious Terrace Houses, and the renowned Temple of Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
  • Skip the long lines and get priority access to the places you’ll visit
  • See and take a picture of the old terrace houses where rich Ephesians lived 
  • Stop for photos at the best spots in Ephesus and for a tasty Turkish lunch 
  • Check out Virgin Mary House, St John Basilica, Odeon Temple, and more‚Ä®

According to your private tour pick-up time meet with your guide and start your full-day tour. Visit The House of Virgin Mary; located 6km to the north of the ruins of Ephesus, a church was built from the 6C AD to the top of the foundations of a house from 1C AD and it is declared by the church to be the final house where Mary spent her last days.  Continue with the Ancient Ephesus; An Archeological treasure, The best-preserved classical city in Eastern Mediterranean. During the 1C AD, Ephesus was the second-largest city on the planet after Rome with more than 250,000 citizens. It was in the center of the known world and played the role of a gateway between the East and the West with its giant harbor, it was also the center of trading in antiquity. It was not only a rich commercial city but also the honeymoon place of Mark Anthony and Cleopatra. An impressive city, ƒ±t is also home to one of the Seven wonders of the ancient world, Temple of Artemis. Ephesus is also so well preserved that, walking on the ancient streets among the beautiful monuments such as the third largest library of the ancient world or the largest roman theatre on the Asia continent, gives you the feeling of a time traveler. Terrace Houses which from the time of Augustus, these dwellings of wealthy Ephesians, were decorated with beautiful frescoes and mosaics. The houses had luxurious bedrooms, bathrooms and kitchens. Archeologisit have been excavating 7 houses owned by the richest Ephesians. These were high ranking officers, governors and rich trades man. Next; Temple of Artemis or Artemision was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Its ancient cult dedicated to Artemis was very famous in antiquity and made Ephesus a much-visited pilgrimage place. There were a totally of 127 ionic columns with a height of 19m. The temple is also considered to be the earliest bank of the ancient world. At the end of the tour drive you back to the departure point.     Basilica of John: 3 km away from the ruins of Ephesus a small church was built dedicated to John in 2C AD, Later in 6C AD it was replaced by a huge basilica built by Emperor Justinian, The impressive ruins are still standing today

This revered site features a 6th-century AD church built atop the foundations of a 1st-century AD house, believed to be the final residence of Mary, the mother of Jesus. Recognized by the Church, it is a place of pilgrimage and reflection. 

Continue your journey to Ancient Ephesus, an archaeological gem and the best-preserved classical city in the Eastern Mediterranean. In the 1st century AD, Ephesus was the world's second-largest city after Rome, boasting over 250,000 citizens and serving as a bustling hub of trade between the East and West. Walk the ancient streets and marvel at the stunning monuments, including the Temple of Artemis—one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World—the third-largest library of antiquity, and the grandest Roman theatre in Asia.

The Terrace Houses, dating back to the time of Augustus, reveal the opulent lifestyles of Ephesus's wealthy elite with their intricate frescoes and mosaics. Conclude your tour with a visit to the Temple of Artemis, appreciating its historical significance as both a religious sanctuary and one of the earliest banks in the ancient world.

title: Day Tour to Cappadocia from Istanbul
description:
Experience a full-day tour of Cappadocia's highlights, including the G√∂reme Museum, Devrent Valley, and U√ßhisar Castle, with seamless transfers and flights from Istanbul, ending with breathtaking panoramic views of the region.
  • Discover Unique Cappadocia with customized tour by plane from/to Istanbul
  • Enjoy the fascinating view of fairy chimneys
  • Experience the life of the locals, learn how to make pottery from local experts
  • Tasty delicious foods from the Turkish cuisine
  • Internal flight tickets, Skip-The-Line Tickets, and Airport transfers provided

Upon arrival at Kayseri Airport, you will be greeted by your driver and drive to Cappadocia. Here you will join the other group participants and start your full-day tour.

Explore Goreme Museum, which consists of many rock-cut churches from the second half of the 9C, with beautiful colorful frescoes decorating the walls.  
Next, visit Devrent Valley, famous for its quirky animal-shaped rocks. It looks like a sculpture zoo made by nature. There is even a rock pillar that looks like the Virgin Mary holding Jesus Christ. Take in the unique lunar landscape of the valley and feel like you're in another world.  

Next, visit Pasabagi, which means the Pacha's vineyard. This site is also called Monks Valley. The hermitage of Simeon monks was here.  

Next, visit Avanos, where you will enjoy a typical Turkish lunch and experience making pottery with local experts.  

We continue to Goreme Panorama, which has one of the best panoramic views of the fairy chimneys.  

Next, visit Uchisar, the highest natural rock castle that provides a magnificent panorama of the surrounding area.  

Once the tour is finished, we drive you to Kayseri Airport for your 1 hour 30 min domestic flight to Istanbul.  

Upon arrival at Istanbul Airport, you will be greeted by your driver who will drive you safely back to your hotel.

  • Devrent Valley

title: Full-Day Ephesus Tour
description:
Discover the archaeological wonders of Ephesus, including the best-preserved classical city in the Eastern Mediterranean, the House of the Virgin Mary, and the Temple of Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, all while walking among ancient streets and monuments that evoke the feeling of being a time traveler.
  • Visit Ancient Ephesus; The best preserved classical city in Eastern Mediterranean.
  • See Temple of Artemis; was one of the Seven Wonders of the ancient World.
  • Visit House of Virgin Mary where she spent her last days
  • Learn history about early christians and Romans from your expert local guide
  • Enjoy typical Turkish Food in local restaurant
  • Skip-The-Line to get tickets provided

According to your tour pick-up time, meet with your guide and start your full-day tour.

First visiting place is Ephesus; an archaeological treasure and the best-preserved classical city in the Eastern Mediterranean. During the 1C AD, Ephesus was the second-largest city on the planet after Rome with more than 250,000 citizens. It was in the center of the known world and played the role of a gateway between the East and the West. With its giant harbor, it was also the center of trading in antiquity. It was not only a rich commercial city but also an impressive city that even Mark Anthony and Cleopatra spent their honeymoon in Ephesus. It is also home to one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, the Temple of Artemis. Ephesus is so well-preserved that walking on the ancient streets among the beautiful monuments, such as the third-largest library of the ancient world or the largest Roman theatre on the Asian continent, gives you the feeling of a time traveler.

Next, visit The House of Virgin Mary; located 6 km to the north of the ruins of Ephesus, a church was built from the 6C AD on top of the foundations of a house from the 1C AD, and it is declared by the church to be the final house where Mary spent her last days. It is also believed that the Assumption took place there on the 15th of August.

After lunch, continue to The Temple of Artemis. The Temple of Artemis, or Artemision, was one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World. Its ancient cult dedicated to Artemis was very famous in antiquity and made Ephesus a much-visited pilgrimage place. There were a total of 127 ionic columns with a height of 19m. The temple is also considered to be the earliest bank of the ancient world.

At the end of the tour, drive back to the departure point.

Key Sights
  • Ancient Ephesus
  • Temple of Artemis
  • House of Virgin Mary

title: Secret Treasures of Istanbul Tour
description:
Explore Istanbul's rich history with a full-day tour, starting with the awe-inspiring Hagia Sophia, the grand Basilica Cistern, and the opulent Topkapi Palace. Continue your journey through the ancient Hippodrome, marvel at the iconic Blue Mosque, and immerse yourself in the vibrant atmosphere of the Grand Bazaar, one of the world's largest and oldest covered markets.
  • Explore Historical Peninsula in a unique, personal way
  • Be enchanted by the mosaics of Hagia Sophia
  • See the priceless treasures of Topkapi palace including HAREM Section
  • Visit biggest underground cistern of Constantinople.
  • Experience shopping in the grand bazaar, which has been the center of shopping for centuries
  • Walk along the historical hippodrome and see German Fountain and obelisk
  • See the colorful mosaics of the Sultanahmet mosque
  • Learn history about Byzantines, Ottomans and Modern Turks from your expert local guide
  • Do not wait in the long queues with Skip-The-Line tickets provided for you


According to your tour pick-up time, meet with your guide and start your full-day tour.

Explore Hagia Sophia; meaning Divine Wisdom, Hagia Sophia was the largest building on earth barring the Egyptian Pyramids or the Great Wall of China. Today's Hagia Sophia was built by Emperor Justinian in 537 AD. It was the religious center of the city during the Byzantine period. It was used as a church for 916 years and as a mosque for 481 years. In 1934, by the order of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, it was converted into a museum and has since been open to visitors.

Next, visit the Basilica Cistern; the size of a cathedral, it is 143m long and 65m wide and can hold up to 80,000 cubic meters (or 17.5 million gallons) of water. There are 336 giant columns (mostly Ionic or Corinthian in style) supporting the structure in 12 rows of 28 columns.

Next, visit Topkapi Palace. As well as being the imperial residence of the Sultan, the palace was also the seat of government for the Ottoman Empire. It housed the Ottoman sultans for nearly 400 years until the Dolmabahçe Palace was built. In 1924, it was converted into a museum. Today it is famous for its harem, royal treasury, and holy relics sections.

Continue to the Hippodrome; built by the Roman Emperor Septimus Severus in 203 AD, during the Roman period, the Hippodrome was the civil center for the people of the city where once 100,000 spectators could be held. Located in the heart of Sultanahmet, surrounded by the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace, today it is home to The Egyptian Obelisk (Dikilita≈ü), The Serpentine Column (Burma sütun), The Constantine Column, and the German Fountain.

Next, visit the Blue Mosque; built by the Ottoman Sultan Ahmet I in the year 1616, it is located opposite Hagia Sophia. The Blue Mosque today is one of the most famous landmarks of the old city with its six minarets and magnificent dome. Although it is officially named Sultanahmet Mosque, the nickname Blue Mosque was given to it by visitors because of the amazing blue tiles decorating the interior walls.

Next, visit the Grand Bazaar; with 18 entrances and more than 4000 shops, it is one of the greatest bazaars in the world. It was built between 1455-1461 by Sultan Mehmet the Conqueror. Today, shops selling the same kind of merchandise tend to be congregated in their own streets or inns as it was in the original Ottoman system.

Key Sights
  • Hagia Sophia
  • Topkapi Palace(Harem included)
  • Basilica Cistern
  • Hippodrome
  • Blue Mosque
  • Grand Bazaar
Included
  • Lunch in a local restaurant
  • Professionel licensed tour Guide
  • All sightseeing mentioned in the itinerary
  • Transfer service from/to Hotels, Istanbul Port
  • Land transportation by air-conditioned non-smoking vehicle

Excluded
  • Admission fees to attractions
  • Beverage during the tour
  • Tips to the guide & driver (optional)
  • Personal expences

Today's Hagia Sophia was built by Emperor Justinian in 537 AD. It was the religious center of the city during the Byzantine period. It was used as a church for 916 years and as a mosque for 481 years. In 1934, by the order of Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, it was converted into a museum and has since been open to visitors.

Next, visit the Basilica Cistern; the size of a cathedral, it is 143m long and 65m wide and can hold up to 80,000 cubic meters (or 17.5 million gallons) of water. There are 336 giant columns (mostly Ionic or Corinthian in style) supporting the structure in 12 rows of 28 columns.

Then, visit Topkapi Palace. As well as being the imperial residence of the Sultan, the palace was also the seat of government for the Ottoman Empire. It housed the Ottoman sultans for nearly 400 years until the Dolmabahçe Palace was built. In 1924, it was converted into a museum. Today it is famous for its harem, royal treasury, and holy relics sections.

Continue to the Hippodrome; built by the Roman Emperor Septimus Severus in 203 AD, during the Roman period, the Hippodrome was the civil center for the people of the city where once 100,000 spectators could be held. Located in the heart of Sultanahmet, surrounded by the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, and Topkapi Palace, today it is home to The Egyptian Obelisk (Dikilita≈ü), The Serpentine Column (Burma sütun), The Constantine Column, and the German Fountain.

Next, visit the Blue Mosque; built by the Ottoman Sultan Ahmet I in the year 1616, it is located opposite Hagia Sophia. The Blue Mosque today is one of the most famous landmarks of the old city with its six minarets and magnificent dome.
